Quote: Cynics are simply thwarted romantics.

Author: John Steinbeck,  Cannery Row
Quote: It has always seemed strange to me...The things we admire in men, kindness and generosity, openness, honesty, understanding and feeling, are the concomitants of failure in our system. And those traits we detest, sharpness, greed, acquisitiveness, meanness, egotism and self-interest, are the traits of success. And while men admire the quality of the first they love the produce of the second.

Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald,  This Side of Paradise
Quote: It was always the becoming he dreamed of, never the being.

Author: Anais Nin
Quote: Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one's courage.

Author: Mary Oliver
Quote: When it's over, I want to say: all my lifeI was a bride married to amazement.I was the bridegroom, taking the world into my arms. When it is over, I don't want to wonderif I have made of my life something particular, and real.I don't want to find myself sighing and frightened,or full of argument. I don't want to end up simply having visited this world.

Author: Thomas Merton,  Love and Living
Quote: Love is our true destiny. We do not find the meaning of life by ourselves alone - we find it with another.

Author: Robert T. Kiyosaki
Quote: It's not what you say out of your mouth that determines your life, it's what you whisper to yourself that has the most power!

Author: Fernando Pessoa,  The Book of Disquiet
Quote: There are ships sailing to many ports, but not a single one goes where life is not painful.

Author: Theodore Roosevelt
Quote: The things that will destroy America are prosperity-at-any-price, peace-at-any-price, safety-first instead of duty-first, the love of soft living, and the get-rich-quick theory of life.

Author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning,  Aurora Leigh
Quote: Earth's crammed with heaven...But only he who sees, takes off his shoes.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: I think that the best thing we can do for our children is to allow them to do things for themselves, allow them to be strong, allow them to experience life on their own terms, allow them to take the subway... let them be better people, let them believe more in themselves.

Author: Harper Lee,  To Kill a Mockingbird
Quote: It’s never an insult to be called what somebody thinks is a bad name. It just shows you how poor that person is, it doesn’t hurt you.

Author: Ben Okri
Quote: The most authentic thing about us is our capacity to create, to overcome, to endure, to transform, to love and to be greater than our suffering.

Author: Tom Hiddleston
Quote: Haters never win. I just think that's true about life, because negative energy always costs in the end.

Author: Homer,  The Odyssey
Quote: Of all creatures that breathe and move upon the earth, nothing is bred that is weaker than man.

Author: Willa Cather
Quote: Most of the basic material a writer works with is acquired before the age of fifteen.

Author: Alan Moore,  V for Vendetta
Quote: Knowledge, like air, is vital to life. Like air, no one should be denied it.

Author: J. R. Martinez
Quote: I've learned in my life that it's important to be able to step outside your comfort zone and be challenged with something you're not familiar or accustomed to. That challenge will allow you to see what you can do.

Author: Henry David Thoreau
Quote: Our truest life is when we are in dreams awake.

Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
Quote: If you've never eaten while crying you don t know what life tastes like.

Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe,  Collected Works
Quote: There is nothing more frightful than ignorance in action.

Author: David Lynch
Quote: Meditation is to dive all the way within, beyond thought, to the source of thought and pure consciousness. It enlarges the container, every time you transcend. When you come out, you come out refreshed, filled with energy and enthusiasm for life.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  $3.33
Quote: Patience and wisdom walk hand in hand, like two one-armed lovers.

Author: John Green,  Looking for Alaska
Quote: At some point we all look up and realize we are lost in a maze.

Author: Khaled Hosseini,  The Kite Runner
Quote: People say that eyes are windows to the soul.

Author: Markus Zusak,  The Book Thief
Quote: I want words at my funeral. But I guess that means you need life in your life.

Author: Albert Camus,  The Plague
Quote: I have no idea what's awaiting me, or what will happen when this all ends. For the moment I know this: there are sick people and they need curing.

Author: J. R. R. Tolkien
Quote: Many that live deserve death. And some that die deserve life. Can you give it to them? Then do not be too eager to deal out death in judgement. For even the very wise cannot see all ends.

Author: Oprah Winfrey
Quote: Breathe. Let go. And remind yourself that this very moment is the only one you know you have for sure.

Author: Jess C. Scott
Quote: A fit, healthy body—that is the best fashion statement

Author: Jack London
Quote: I would rather be ashes than dust!I would rather that my spark should burn out in a brilliant blaze than it should be stifled by dry-rot.I would rather be a superb meteor, every atom of me in magnificent glow, than a sleepy and permanent planet.The function of man is to live, not to exist.I shall not waste my days trying to prolong them.I shall use my time.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: What does it mean to be the best? It means you have to be better than the number two guy. But what gratification is there in that? He's a loser—that’s why he's number two.

Author: T.S. Eliot,  The Love Song of J. Alfred Prufrock and Others
Quote: For I have known them all already, known them all—Have known the evenings, mornings, afternoons,I have measured out my life with coffee spoons.

Author: جلال الدين الرومي
Quote: ما تبحث عنه يبحث عنك

Author: Rainer Maria Rilke
Quote: The purpose of life is to be defeated by greater and greater things.

Author: Edwin Markham
Quote: The crest and crowning of all good, Life's final star, is brotherhood.

Author: Muhammad Ali
Quote: Life is a gamble. You can get hurt, but people die in plane crashes, lose their arms and legs in car accidents; people die every day. Same with fighters: some die, some get hurt, some go on. You just don't let yourself believe it will happen to you.

Author: Steve Jobs
Quote: Don’t let the noise of others’ opinions drown out your own inner voice."[Stanford University commencement speech, 2005]

Author: Emily Giffin,  Something Borrowed
Quote: But I have learned that you make your own happiness, that part of going for what you want means losing something else. And when the stakes are high, the losses can be that much greater.

Author: Tupac Shakur
Quote: There's gon' be some stuff you gon' seethat's gon' make it hard to smile in the future.But through whatever you see,through all the rain and the pain,you gotta keep your sense of humor.You gotta be able to smile through all this bullshit.Remember that.

Author: Vladimir Nabokov,  Lolita
Quote: Don't cry, I'm sorry to have deceived you so much, but that's how life is.

Author: Andrew Brown
Quote: The Internet is so big, so powerful and pointless that for some people it is a complete substitute for life.

Author: Stieg Larsson,  The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
Quote: Then I discovered that being related is no guarantee of love!

Author: Charlotte Brontë,  Jane Eyre
Quote: Even for me life had its gleams of sunshine.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: Life doesn’t get easier or more forgiving, we get stronger and more resilient.

Author: Jim Rohn
Quote: If you don't design your own life plan, chances are you'll fall into someone else's plan. And guess what they have planned for you? Not much.

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche
Quote: Art is the proper task of life.

Author: Terry Pratchett
Quote: This isn't life in the fast lane, it's life in the oncoming traffic.

Author: Sarah Dessen,  Someone Like You
Quote: You can't just plan a moment when things get back on track, just as you can't plan the moment you lose your way in the first place.

Author: Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez
Quote: Human beings are not born once and for all on the day their mothers give birth to them, but ... life obliges them over and over again to give birth to themselves.

Author: Yoko Ono
Quote: Spring passes and one remembers one's innocence.Summer passes and one remembers one's exuberance.Autumn passes and one remembers one's reverence.Winter passes and one remembers one's perseverance.

Author: William Shakespeare,  Macbeth
Quote: Life ... is a taleTold by an idiot, full of sound and fury,Signifying nothing.

Author: Baltasar Gracian
Quote: True friendship multiplies the good in life and divides its evils. Strive to have friends, for life without friends is like life on a desert island... to find one real friend in a lifetime is good fortune; to keep him is a blessing.

Author: Bill Watterson
Quote: When life gives you lemons, chunk it right back.

Author: Sarah Dessen,  The Truth About Forever
Quote: I don't get it,' Caroline said, bemused. 'She's the only one with wings. Why is that?'There were so many questions in life. You couldn't ever have all the answers. But I knew this one.It's so she can fly,' I said. Then I started to run.

Author: Douglas Adams,  The Salmon of Doubt
Quote: We are stuck with technology when what we really want is just stuff that works.

Author: Elvis Presley
Quote: When things go wrong, don't go with them.

Author: Sue Monk Kidd,  The Secret Life of Bees
Quote: If you need something from somebody always give that person a way to hand it to you.

Author: Tony Robbins
Quote: Only those who have learned the power of sincere and selfless contribution experience life's deepest joy: true fulfillment.

Author: Fefe Dobson
Quote: The things that drive me are poverty, and pain, and knowing that I don't want to end up being alone and I want to do something with my life and I want the name Dobson to remain in everyone's heads. Basically, just to rock and be the best performer I can be, and be true, and be real, and give people the real Fefe, nothing fake, all real.

Author: Sarah Dessen,  What Happened to Goodbye
Quote: Home wasn't a set house, or a single town on a map. It was wherever the people who loved you were, whenever you were together. Not a place, but a moment, and then another, building on each other like bricks to create a solid shelter that you take with you for your entire life, wherever you may go.

Author: Hans Christian Andersen,  The Fairy Tale of My Life: An Autobiography
Quote: To travel is to live.

Author: Tom Robbins,  Even Cowgirls Get the Blues
Quote: There are many things worth living for, a few things worth dying for, and nothing worth killing for.

Author: Rabindranath Tagore
Quote: Clouds come floating into my life, no longer to carry rain or usher storm, but to add color to my sunset sky.

Author: Kevin Conroy
Quote: Everyone is handed adversity in life. No one's journey is easy. It's how they handle it that makes people unique.

Author: Matthew Quick,  The Silver Linings Playbook
Quote: Life is not a PG feel-good movie. Real life often ends badly. Literature tries to document this reality, while showing us it is still possible for us to endure nobly.

Author: David Levithan,  The Lover's Dictionary
Quote: It scares me how hard it is to remember life before you. I can't even make the comparisons anymore, because my memories of that time have all the depth of a photograph. It seems foolish to play games of better and worse. It's simply a matter of is and is no longer.

Author: Nicholas Sparks,  Dear John
Quote: We’d met at a carefree time, a moment full of promise, in its place now were the harsh lessons of the real world.

Author: محمد المنسي قنديل,  انكسار الروح
Quote: هكذا القاعدة دائماً ..تأتى الفرص لمن لا يريدها

Author: Jim Morrison
Quote: No one here gets out alive.

Author: J.K. Rowling,  Very Good Lives: The Fringe Benefits of Failure and the Importance of Imagination
Quote: As is a tale, so is life: not how long it is, but how good it is, is what matters.I wish you all very good lives.

Author: Charles Bukowski,  Pulp
Quote: It wasn’t my day. My week. My month. My year. My life. God damn it.

Author: Marcus Aurelius,  Meditations
Quote: Our life is what our thoughts make it.

Author: Billy Graham
Quote: The greatest legacy one can pass on to one's children and grandchildren is not money or other material things accumulated in one's life, but rather a legacy of character and faith.

Author: Steve Vai
Quote: I have a deep love for life and my fellow human beings. I try to understand everything that everybody does, even if it seems wrong to me.

Author: Alexandre Dumas,  The Count of Monte Cristo
Quote: Moral wounds have this peculiarity - they may be hidden, but they never close; always painful, always ready to bleed when touched, they remain fresh and open in the heart.

Author: Mark Hyman
Quote: Don't get me wrong, I admire elegance and have an appreciation of the finer things in life. But to me, beauty lies in simplicity.

Author: William Shakespeare,  The Merchant of Venice
Quote: How far that little candle throws his beams! So shines a good deed in a weary world.

Author: Joseph Campbell
Quote: Follow your bliss and the universe will open doors for you where there were only walls.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: How would your life be different if…You stopped allowing other people to dilute or poison your day with their words or opinions? Let today be the day…You stand strong in the truth of your beauty and journey through your day without attachment to the validation of others

Author: Helen Keller
Quote: Life is either a great adventure or nothing.

Author: Cormac McCarthy,  The Road
Quote: Nobody wants to be here and nobody wants to leave.

Author: Michel Legrand
Quote: The more I live, the more I learn. The more I learn, the more I realize, the less I know.

Author: Oprah Winfrey
Quote: The more you praise and celebrate your life, the more there is in life to celebrate.

Author: Veronica Roth,  Allegiant
Quote: Yeah, sometimes life really sucks,"she says. "But you know what I'm holding on for?"I raise my eyebrows.She raises hers, too, mimicking me."The moments that don't suck,"she says. "The trick is to notice them when they come around.

Author: Sarah Dessen,  The Truth About Forever
Quote: But if everything was always smooth and perfect, you'd get too used to that, you know? You have to have a little bit of disorganization now and then. Otherwise, you'll never really enjoy it when things go right.

Author: J.D. Salinger,  Franny and Zooey
Quote: It's everybody, I mean. Everything everybody does is so — I don't know — not wrong, or even mean, or even stupid necessarily. But just so tiny and meaningless and — sad-making. And the worst part is, if you go bohemian or something crazy like that, you're conforming just as much only in a different way.

Author: Thomas Jefferson
Quote: Our greatest happiness does not depend on the condition of life in which chance has placed us, but is always the result of a good conscience, good health, occupation, and freedom in all just pursuits.

Author: Mark A. Cooper,  Edelweiss Pirates ‘Operation Einstein'
Quote: Life has no remote....get up and change it yourself!

Author: Susan Polis Schutz
Quote: This life is yours. Take the power to choose what you want to do and do it well. Take the power to love what you want in life and love it honestly. Take the power to walk in the forest and be a part of nature. Take the power to control your own life. No one else can do it for you. Take the power to make your life happy.

Author: Will Rogers
Quote: Too many people spend money they haven't earned, to buy things they don't want, to impress people that they don't like.

Author: David Nicholls,  One Day
Quote: You can live your whole life not realizing that what you're looking for is right in front of you.

Author: Jason Mraz
Quote: You’re not obligated to win. You’re obligated to keep trying. To the best you can do everyday.

Author: Paulo Coelho,  The Zahir
Quote: No one should ever ask themselves that: why am I unhappy? The question carries within it the virus that will destroy everything. If we ask that question, it means we want to find out what makes us happy. If what makes us happy is different from what we have now, then we must either change once and for all or stay as we are, feeling even more unhappy.

Author: Bruce Lee
Quote: If you always put limit on everything you do, physical or anything else. It will spread into your work and into your life. There are no limits. There are only plateaus, and you must not stay there, you must go beyond them.

Author: Khalil Gibran
Quote: Your living is determined not so much by what life brings to you as by the attitude you bring to life; not so much by what happens to you as by the way your mind looks at what happens.

Author: Paulo Coelho,  Brida
Quote: Don’t bother trying to explain your emotions. Live everything as intensely as you can and keep whatever you felt as a gift from God. The best way to destroy the bridge between the visible and invisible is by trying to explain your emotions.

Author: Thomas Paine,  Rights of Man
Quote: Independence is my happiness, and I view things as they are, without regard to place or person; my country is the world, and my religion is to do good.

Author: Mitch Albom,  The Five People You Meet in Heaven
Quote: Each affects the other, and the other affects the next, and the world is full of stories, but the stories are all one.

Author: Søren Kierkegaard,  Either/Or: A Fragment of Life
Quote: I see it all perfectly; there are two possible situations — one can either do this or that. My honest opinion and my friendly advice is this: do it or do not do it — you will regret both.

Author: Pattie Boyd
Quote: I love life. There's so much to learn and see all the time, and nothing nicer for me than to wake up, and the sky is blue.

Author: Eckhart Tolle
Quote: Life isn't as serious as the mind makes it out to be.

Author: Garth Stein,  The Art of Racing in the Rain
Quote: He died that day because his body had served its purpose. His soul had done what it came to do, learned what it came to learn, and then was free to leave.

Author: Mahatma Gandhi
Quote: There is more to life than simply increasing its speed.

Author: Alan W. Watts
Quote: This is the real secret of life -- to be completely engaged with what you are doing in the here and now. And instead of calling it work, realize it is play.

Author: Kevin Bacon
Quote: I really believe that all of us have a lot of darkness in our souls. Anger, rage, fear, sadness. I don't think that's only reserved for people who have horrible upbringings. I think it really exists and is part of the human condition. I think in the course of your life you figure out ways to deal with that.

Author: Bill Gates
Quote: Before you were born, your parents weren't as boring as they are now. They got that way from paying your bills, cleaning your clothes and listening to you talk about how cool you thought you were. So before you save the rain forest from the parasites of your parent's generation, try delousing the closet in your own room.

Author: Terry Pratchett,  Guards! Guards!
Quote: If there was anything that depressed him more than his own cynicism, it was that quite often it still wasn't as cynical as real life.

Author: Buddha
Quote: Thousands of candles can be lighted from a single candle, and the life of the candle will not be shortened. Happiness never decreases by being shared.

Author: Joyce Meyer
Quote: I believe that a trusting attitude and a patient attitude go hand in hand. You see, when you let go and learn to trust God, it releases joy in your life. And when you trust God, you're able to be more patient. Patience is not just about waiting for something... it's about how you wait, or your attitude while waiting.

Author: Julian Sands
Quote: The thing about Mumbai is you go five yards and all of human existence is revealed. It's an incredible cavalcade of life, and I love that.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: It’s true, I can’t make you love me. But I can refuse to let you out of your cage.

Author: Cormac McCarthy,  The Road
Quote: People were always getting ready for tomorrow. I didn't believe in that. Tomorrow wasn't getting ready for them. It didn't even know they were there.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: When you hold a grudge, you want someone else’s sorrow to reflect your level of hurt but the two rarely meet.

Author: Christine Feehan,  Night Game
Quote: Life gives us choices. You either grab on with both hands and just go for it, or you sit on the sidelines.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: I want to live my life in such a way that when I get out of bed in the morning, the devil says, "aw shit, he's up!

Author: Olivier Theyskens
Quote: I like to be lazy. I do like to be busy and really active, but when that's done, you can be sure I will be a lazy boy. I like to take time and relax and enjoy life.

Author: Jostein Gaarder,  The Solitaire Mystery
Quote: How terribly sad it was that people are made in such a way that they get used to something as extraordinary as living.

Author: Kahlil Gibran
Quote: We choose our joys and sorrows long before we experience them.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  Whenever You're Gone, I'm Here For You
Quote: I’m not a very good sleeper. But you know what? I’m willing to put in a few extra hours every day to get better. That’s just the kind of hard worker I am.

Author: Sonam Kapoor
Quote: I feel I am lucky. I am grateful for this life that God has given me. I am happy, as I am getting to do work that I want to do and enjoy doing it.

Author: Paulo Coelho,  The Valkyries
Quote: He knew one of the women well, and had shared his universe with her. They had seen the same mountains, and the same trees, although each of them had seem them differently. She knew his weaknesses, his moments of hatred, of despair. Yet she was there at his side. They shared the same universe.

Author: Walt Whitman,  Walt Whitman's Camden Conversations
Quote: I like the scientific spirit—the holding off, the being sure but not too sure, the willingness to surrender ideas when the evidence is against them: this is ultimately fine—it always keeps the way beyond open—always gives life, thought, affection, the whole man, a chance to try over again after a mistake—after a wrong guess.

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche
Quote: Amor Fati – “Love Your Fate”, which is in fact your life.

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche
Quote: Perhaps I know best why it is man alone who laughs; he alone suffers so deeply that he had to invent laughter.

Author: Anthony Burgess,  A Clockwork Orange
Quote: When a man cannot choose, he ceases to be a man.

Author: Keke Palmer
Quote: I think people should have fun. And don't get so down on yourself. Enjoy life and be the best person you can be.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: Don't confuse poor decision-making with destiny. Own your mistakes. It’s ok; we all make them. Learn from them so they can empower you!

Author: Gerard Way
Quote: Being happy doesn't mean that everything is perfect. It means that you've decided to look beyond the imperfections.

Author: Jennifer Niven,  All the Bright Places
Quote: The problem with people is they forget that most of the time it's the small things that count.

Author: Marc Riboud
Quote: Taking pictures is savoring life intensely, every hundredth of a second.

Author: Lana Del Rey
Quote: I was always an unusual girl.My mother told me I had a chameleon soul, no moral compass pointing due north, no fixed personality; just an inner indecisiveness that was as wide and as wavering as the ocean.

Author: Emily Dickinson
Quote: To live is so startling it leaves little time for anything else.

Author: Bill Watterson
Quote: CALVIN:This whole Santa Claus thing just doesn't make sense. Why all the secrecy? Why all the mystery?If the guy exists why doesn't he ever show himself and prove it?And if he doesn't exist what's the meaning of all this?HOBBES:I dunno. Isn't this a religious holiday? CALVIN:Yeah, but actually, I've got the same questions about God.

Author: Chuck Palahniuk,  Survivor
Quote: Six hundred and forty fish later, the only thing I know is everything you love will die. The first time you meet someone special, you can count on them one day being dead and in the ground.

Author: Ann Voskamp
Quote: I have lived pain, and my life can tell: I only deepen the wound of the world when I neglect to give thanks the heavy perfume of wild roses in early July and the song of crickets on summer humid nights and the rivers that run and the stars that rise and the rain that falls and all the good things that a good God gives.

Author: Eleanor Roosevelt
Quote: Never allow a person to tell you no who doesn't have the power to say yes.

Author: Katrina Kaif
Quote: Going by my past journey, I am not certain where life will take me, what turns and twists will happen; nobody knows where they will end up. As life changes direction, I'll flow with it.

Author: Thomas S. Monson
Quote: The spirit of Christmas is the spirit of love and of generosity and of goodness. It illuminates the picture window of the soul, and we look out upon the world's busy life and become more interested in people than in things.

Author: Stephen Hawking
Quote: Life would be tragic if it weren't funny.

Author: Jess C. Scott,  EyeLeash: A Blog Novel
Quote: V-Day…if you need this one day in a year to show everyone else you truly care for “your loved one” I think it’s quite stupid. I hate this commercialism. It’s all artificial, and has nothing to do with real love.

Author: Patrick Rothfuss
Quote: The truth is that the world is full of dragons, and none of us are as powerful or cool as we’d like to be. And that sucks. But when you’re confronted with that fact, you can either crawl into a hole and quit, or you can get out there, take off your shoes, and Bilbo it up.

Author: Neil Gaiman,  Fragile Things: Short Fictions and Wonders
Quote: Do not lose hope — what you seek will be found. Trust ghosts. Trust those that you have helped to help you in their turn. Trust dreams. Trust your heart, and trust your story. (from 'Instructions')

Author: Rachel Vincent,  My Soul to Save
Quote: The worst memories stick with us, while the nice ones always seem to slip through our fingers.

Author: Kevyn Aucoin
Quote: Today I choose life. Every morning when I wake up I can choose joy, happiness, negativity, pain... To feel the freedom that comes from being able to continue to make mistakes and choices - today I choose to feel life, not to deny my humanity but embrace it.

Author: Wayne Dyer
Quote: Freedom means you are unobstructed in living your life as you choose. Anything less is a form of slavery.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: A kind gesture can reach a wound that only compassion can heal.

Author: Rumi
Quote: Grief can be the garden of compassion. If you keep your heart open through everything, your pain can become your greatest ally in your life's search for love and wisdom.

Author: Shel Silverstein,  Where the Sidewalk Ends: The Poems and Drawings of Shel Silverstein
Quote: MagicSandra’s seen a leprechaun,Eddie touched a troll,Laurie danced with witches once,Charlie found some goblins gold.Donald heard a mermaid sing,Susy spied an elf,But all the magic I have knownI've had to make myself.

Author: Kurt Vonnegut
Quote: Take it moment by moment, and you will find that we are all, as I’ve said before, bugs in amber.

Author: Dalai Lama XIV,  The Dalai Lama: A Policy of Kindness: An Anthology of Writings By and About the Dalai Lama
Quote: This is my simple religion. There is no need for temples; no need for complicated philosophy. Our own brain, our own heart is our temple; the philosophy is kindness.

Author: David Cook
Quote: If you can't do anything about it, laugh like hell.

Author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
Quote: We are all connected; To each other, biologically. To the earth, chemically. To the rest of the universe atomically.

Author: George Gordon Byron
Quote: The great object of life is sensation- to feel that we exist, even though in pain.

Author: Jeffrey Eugenides,  The Virgin Suicides
Quote: In the end, it wasn't death that surprised her but the stubbornness of life.

Author: Bede Griffiths
Quote: God had brought me to my knees and made me acknowledge my own nothingness, and out of that knowledge I had been reborn. I was no longer the centre of my life and therefore I could see God in everything.

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: Keep love in your heart. A life without it is like a sunless garden when the flowers are dead. The consciousness of loving and being loved brings a warmth and a richness to life that nothing else can bring.

Author: Bruce Lee
Quote: Be happy, but never satisfied.

Author: Richelle Mead,  Last Sacrifice
Quote: Life, unfortunately, doesn't seem to care what we want.

Author: Tom Leveen,  Party
Quote: I'm the girl nobody knows until she commits suicide. Then suddenly everyone had a class with her.

Author: Brian Tracy
Quote: You cannot control what happens to you, but you can control your attitude toward what happens to you, and in that, you will be mastering change rather than allowing it to master you.

Author: W. Somerset Maugham
Quote: It's a funny thing about life; if you refuse to accept anything but the best, you very often get it.

Author: Anaïs Nin
Quote: Dreams are necessary to life.

Author: Sherrilyn Kenyon,  Kiss of the Night
Quote: Life is a tapestry woven by the decisions we make.

Author: Haruki Murakami,  A Wild Sheep Chase
Quote: Most everything you think you know about me is nothing more than memories.

Author: Jeanette Winterson,  Oranges Are Not the Only Fruit
Quote: I seem to have run in a great circle, and met myself again on the starting line.

Author: Tiffanie DeBartolo,  How to Kill a Rock Star
Quote: Personally, I don’t like inherently happy people. I don’t trust them. I think there’s something seriously wrong with anyone who isn’t at least a little let down by the world.

Author: Julius Erving
Quote: The key to success is to keep growing in all areas of life - mental, emotional, spiritual, as well as physical.

Author: Douglas Adams,  The Salmon of Doubt
Quote: All opinions are not equal. Some are a very great deal more robust, sophisticated and well supported in logic and argument than others.

Author: Madeleine L'Engle,  A Wrinkle in Time
Quote: Life, with its rules, its obligations, and its freedoms, is like a sonnet: You're given the form, but you have to write the sonnet yourself. - Mrs. Whatsit

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: Let today be the day you stop being haunted by the ghost of yesterday. Holding a grudge & harboring anger/resentment is poison to the soul. Get even with people...but not those who have hurt us, forget them, instead get even with those who have helped us.

Author: Gerard Way
Quote: There was a moment in my life when I really wanted to kill myself. And there was one other moment when I was close to that. . . . But even in my most jaded times, I had some hope.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: If you were to ask me the best time of day to fall in love, I'd say, "Now."But you'd also have to remember to factor in the fact that my watch is eleven minutes fast.

Author: John Lennon
Quote: How can I go forward when I don't know which way I'm facing?

Author: Oliver James
Quote: Do your own thing on your own terms and get what you came here for

Author: Joseph Addison
Quote: Three grand essentials to happiness in this life are something to do, something to love, and something to hope for.

Author: Rainer Maria Rilke,  Letters to a Young Poet
Quote: If your daily life seems poor, do not blame it; blame yourself, tell yourself that you are not poet enough to call forth its riches; for to the creator there is no poverty and no poor indifferent place.

Author: Jason Mraz
Quote: I’ve come to the conclusion that people who wear headphones while they walk, are much happier, more confident, and more beautiful individuals than someone making the solitary drudge to work without acknowledging their own interests and power.

Author: Philip James Bailey,  Festus: A Poem
Quote: We should count time by heart-throbs. He most lives,Who thinks most, feels noblest, acts the best.

Author: C.S. Lewis,  The Silver Chair
Quote: It is a very funny thing that the sleepier you are, the longer you take about getting to bed.

Author: Jason Mraz
Quote: Transformation is my favorite game and in my experience, anger and frustration are the result of you not being authentic somewhere in your life or with someone in your life. Being fake about anything creates a block inside of you. Life can’t work for you if you don’t show up as you.

Author: Roman Payne
Quote: You must give everything to make your life as beautiful as the dreams that dance in your imagination.

Author: Nelson Mandela
Quote: There is no passion to be found playing small - in settling for a life that is less than the one you are capable of living.

Author: Pope John Paul II
Quote: The great danger for family life, in the midst of any society whose idols are pleasure, comfort and independence, lies in the fact that people close their hearts and become selfish.

Author: Jonathan Safran Foer,  Everything Is Illuminated
Quote: I am always sad, I think. Perhaps this signifies that I am not sad at all, because sadness is something lower than your normal disposition, and I am always the same thing. Perhaps I am the only person in the world, then, who never becomes sad. Perhaps I am lucky.

Author: Anthony Robbins
Quote: Live life fully while you're here. Experience everything. Take care of yourself and your friends. Have fun, be crazy, be weird. Go out and screw up! You're going to anyway, so you might as well enjoy the process. Take the opportunity to learn from your mistakes: find the cause of your problem and eliminate it. Don't try to be perfect; just be an excellent example of being human.

Author: Julie Kagawa,  The Iron King
Quote: You made me feel alive again.

Author: Mary Anne Radmacher
Quote: I am not the same having seen the moon shine on the other side of the world.

Author: Virginia Woolf
Quote: To look life in the face, always, to look life in the face, and to know it for what it is...at last, to love it for what it is, and then, to put it away...

Author: Margaret Mitchell,  Gone with the Wind
Quote: Hardships make or break people.

Author: Criss Jami,  Diotima, Battery, Electric Personality
Quote: Closed in a room, my imagination becomes the universe, and the rest of the world is missing out.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  Love quotes for the ages. Specifically ages 18-81.
Quote: Love is like whoa! Actually, it's closer to woe.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: It doesn't matter what you did or where you were...it matters where you are and what you're doing. Get out there! Sing the song in your heart and NEVER let anyone shut you up!!

Author: Walt Disney Company
Quote: All the adversity I've had in my life, all my troubles and obstacles, have strengthened me... You may not realize it when it happens, but a kick in the teeth may be the best thing in the world for you.

Author: Nelson Mandela
Quote: There is no passion to be found playing small - in settling for a life that is less than the one you are capable of living.

Author: Bertolt Brecht
Quote: The human race tends to remember the abuses to which it has been subjected rather than the endearments. What's left of kisses? Wounds, however, leave scars.

Author: Zelda Fitzgerald
Quote: I don't want to live, I want to love first and live incidentally.

Author: Wilferd Peterson
Quote: Walk with the dreamers, the believers, the courageous, the cheerful, the planners, the doers, the successful people with their heads in the clouds and their feet on the ground. Let their spirit ignite a fire within you to leave this world better than when you found it...

Author: Amelia Atwater-Rhodes,  Demon in My View
Quote: Life is nothing without a little chaos to make it interesting.

Author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam
Quote: The bird is powered by its own life and by its motivation.

Author: Alvar Aalto
Quote: Building art is a synthesis of life in materialised form. We should try to bring in under the same hat not a splintered way of thinking, but all in harmony together.

Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry,  Flight to Arras
Quote: No single event can awaken within us a stranger whose existence we had never suspected. To live is to be slowly born.

Author: T.S. Eliot
Quote: There will be time, there will be timeTo prepare a face to meet the faces that you meet.

Author: Leo Buscaglia
Quote: Too often we underestimate the power of a touch, a smile, a kind word, alistening ear, an honest compliment, or the smallest act of caring, allof which have the potential to turn a life around.

Author: Jocelyn Soriano,  Mend My Broken Heart
Quote: To be rejected by someone doesn't mean you should also reject yourself or that you should think of yourself as a lesser person. It doesn't mean that nobody will ever love you anymore. Remember that only ONE person has rejected you at the moment, and it only hurt so much because to you, that person's opinion symbolized the opinion of the whole world, of God.

Author: Lucille Ball
Quote: One of the things I learned the hard way was that it doesn't pay to get discouraged. Keeping busy and making optimism a way of life can restore your faith in yourself.

Author: E.B. White,  Charlotte's Web
Quote: After all, what's a life, anyway? We're born, we live a little while, we die.

Author: Steve Maraboli
Quote: One of the most spiritual things you can do is embrace your humanity. Connect with those around you today. Say, "I love you", "I'm sorry", "I appreciate you", "I'm proud of you"...whatever you're feeling. Send random texts, write a cute note, embrace your truth and share it...cause a smile today for someone else...and give plenty of hugs.

Author: Ally Carter,  Only the Good Spy Young
Quote: ...nothing ever happens quickly (except when it does). Nothing is ever, ever easy (except when it is). And, most of all, nothing ever goes perfectly according to plan (except in the movies).

Author: Thomas A. Edison
Quote: Many of life's failures are people who did not realize how close they were to success when they gave up.

Author: Bill Ayers
Quote: You need to find a way to live your life, that it doesn't make a mockery of your values.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  The Titanic would never have sunk if it were made out of a sink.
Quote: The only gift I have to give, is the ability to receive. If giving is a gift, and it surely is, then my gift to you is to allow you to give to me.

Author: Yann Martel,  Life of Pi
Quote: Dare I say I miss him? I do. I miss him. I still see him in my dreams. They are nightmares mostly, but nightmares tinged with love.I still cannot understand how he could abandon me so unceremoniously, without any sort of goodbye, without looking back even once. That pain is like an axe that chops at my heart.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  Who Moved My Choose?: An Amazing Way to Deal With Change by Deciding to Let Indecision Into Your Life
Quote: I’m willing to die for the woman I love. I just want to take 75 years to do it.

Author: Douglas Adams,  The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
Quote: We demand rigidly defined areas of doubt and uncertainty!

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: I have learned that you can go anywhere you want to go and do anything you want to do and buy all the things that you want to buy and meet all the people that you want to meet and learn all the things that you desire to learn and if you do all these things but are not madly in love: you have still not begun to live.

Author: Zig Ziglar
Quote: When you encourage others, you in the process are encouraged because you're making a commitment and difference in that person's life. Encouragement really does make a difference.

Author: Coco Chanel
Quote: There is no time for cut-and-dried monotony. There is time for work. And time for love. That leaves no other time.

Author: Thomas Merton
Quote: If you want to identify me, ask me not where I live, or what I like to eat, or how I comb my hair, but ask me what I am living for, in detail, ask me what I think is keeping me from living fully for the thing I want to live for.

Author: James Joyce,  A Portrait of the Artist as a Young Man
Quote: You made me confess the fears that I have. But I will tell you also what I do not fear. I do not fear to be alone or to be spurned for another or to leave whatever I have to leave. And I am not afraid to make a mistake, even a great mistake, a lifelong mistake and perhaps as long as eternity too.

Author: Jean-Paul Sartre,  No Exit
Quote: You are -- your life, and nothing else.

Author: Steve Jobs
Quote: If you live each day as it was your last, someday you'll most certainly be right

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: The aim of life is self-development. To realize one's nature perfectly - that is what each of us is here for.

Author: Patricia McCormick,  Cut
Quote: Look. I have a strategy. Why expect anything? If you don’t expect anything, you don’t get disappointed.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: People tend to be generous when sharing their nonsense, fear, and ignorance. And while they seem quite eager to feed you their negativity, please remember that sometimes the diet we need to be on is a spiritual and emotional one. Be cautious with what you feed your mind and soul. Fuel yourself with positivity and let that fuel propel you into positive action.

Author: Langston Hughes
Quote: I have discovered in life that there are ways of getting almost anywhere you want to go, if you really want to go.

Author: Pascal Mercier,  Night Train to Lisbon
Quote: We leave something of ourselves behind when we leave a place, we stay there, even though we go away. And there are things in us that we can find again only by going back there.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Don’t try to hog loneliness and keep it all to yourself. Share it with a special someone.

Author: Rick Warren
Quote: You were made by God and for God and until you understand that, life will never make sense.

Author: Leonard Cohen
Quote: Poetry is just the evidence of life. If your life is burning well, poetry is just the ash.

Author: Chris Kyle
Quote: It was my duty to shoot the enemy, and I don't regret it. My regrets are for the people I couldn't save: Marines, soldiers, buddies. I'm not naive, and I don't romanticize war. The worst moments of my life have come as a SEAL. But I can stand before God with a clear conscience about doing my job.

Author: مصطفى صادق الرافعي
Quote: اذا لم تزد على الحياة شيئاً تكن أنت زائداً عليها

Author: Winston S. Churchill
Quote: To each there comes in their lifetime a special moment when they are figuratively tapped on the shoulder and offered the chance to do a very special thing, unique to them and fitted to their talents. What a tragedy if that moment finds them unprepared or unqualified for that which could have been their finest hour.

Author: Michael Jordan
Quote: I've missed more than 9000 shots in my career. I've lost almost 300 games. 26 times, I've been trusted to take the game winning shot and missed. I've failed over and over and over again in my life. And that is why I succeed.

Author: Rumi
Quote: You were born with potential. You were born with goodness and trust. You were born with ideals and dreams. You were born with greatness. You were born with wings. You are not meant for crawling, so don't. You have wings. Learn to use them and fly.

Author: Margaret Mitchell,  Gone with the Wind
Quote: Perhaps - I want the old days back again and they'll never come back, and I am haunted by the memory of them and of the world falling about my ears.

Author: Elizabeth Gilbert,  Committed: A Skeptic Makes Peace with Marriage
Quote: Sometimes life is too hard to be alone, and sometimes life is too good to be alone.

Author: Julian Barnes,  The Sense of an Ending
Quote: How often do we tell our own life story? How often do we adjust, embellish, make sly cuts? And the longer life goes on, the fewer are those around to challenge our account, to remind us that our life is not our life, merely the story we have told about our life. Told to others, but—mainly—to ourselves.

Author: Dorothea Lange
Quote: The camera is an instrument that teaches people how to see without a camera.

Author: Mary Shelley,  Frankenstein
Quote: Life, although it may only be an accumulation of anguish, is dear to me, and I will defend it.

Author: Natsuki Takaya
Quote: Those who hurt others will also hurt themselves.

Author: Jacqueline Carey,  Kushiel's Dart
Quote: All knowledge is worth having.

Author: Khaled Hosseini,  The Kite Runner
Quote: Quiet is peace. Tranquility. Quiet is turning down the volume knob on life. Silence is pushing the off button. Shutting it down. All of it. - Amir

Author: Elizabeth Cady Stanton
Quote: The moment we begin to fear the opinions of others and hesitate to tell the truth that is in us, and from motives of policy are silent when we should speak, the divine floods of light and life no longer flow into our souls.

Author: Will Durant,  The Story of Philosophy
Quote: Science is organized knowledge. Wisdom is organized life.

Author: Maggie Stiefvater,  The Raven Boys
Quote: Is this thing safe?""Safe as life,"Gansey replied.

Author: Myles Munroe
Quote: The value of life is not in its duration, but in its donation. You are not important because of how long you live, you are important because of how effective you live.

Author: Mary Tyler Moore
Quote: You can't be brave if you've only had wonderful things happen to you.

Author: Jennifer Salaiz
Quote: I was in the biggest breakdown of my life when I stopped crying long enough to let the words of my epiphany really sink in. That whore, karma, had finally made her way around, and had just bitch-slapped me right across the face. The realization only made me cry harder.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: The beautiful journey of today can only begin when we learn to let go of yesterday.

Author: Ernest Hemingway
Quote: Madame, all stories, if continued far enough, end in death, and he is no true-story teller who would keep that from you.

Author: Henry David Thoreau,  Walden
Quote: The cost of a thing is the amount of what I will call life which is required to be exchanged for it, immediately or in the long run.

Author: Harry Houdini
Quote: I am a great admirer of mystery and magic. Look at this life - all mystery and magic.

Author: Marcus Aurelius,  Meditations
Quote: The object of life is not to be on the side of the majority, but to escape finding oneself in the ranks of the insane.

Author: Christina Westover
Quote: Unrequited love is the infinite curse of a lonely heart.

Author: Paulo Coelho,  Veronika Decides to Die
Quote: You are someone who is different, but who wants to be the same as everyone else. And that in my view is a serious illness. God chose you to be different. Why are you disappointing God with this kind of attitude?

Author: Michael Jackson
Quote: If you enter this world knowing you are loved and you leave this world knowing the same, then everything that happens in between can be dealt with.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  Love quotes for the ages. Specifically ages 18-81.
Quote: Stairs, are they going up or are they going down? They’re so confusing! If love were a physical thing, it would be stairs.

Author: Lisa Wingate,  A Month of Summer
Quote: The hardest thing about the road not taken is that you never know where it might have led.

Author: Rainbow Rowell,  Eleanor & Park
Quote: If you can’t save your own life, is it even worth saving?

Author: Jack Kerouac,  On the Road
Quote: Our battered suitcases were piled on the sidewalk again; we had longer ways to go. But no matter, the road is life

Author: Jean de La Fontaine
Quote: Friendship is the shadow of the evening, which increases with the setting sun of life.

Author: Earl Nightingale
Quote: Learn to enjoy every minute of your life. Be happy now. Don't wait for something outside of yourself to make you happy in the future. Think how really precious is the time you have to spend, whether it's at work or with your family. Every minute should be enjoyed and savored.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  The Titanic would never have sunk if it were made out of a sink.
Quote: Like Alexander the Great and Caesar, I’m out to conquer the world. But first I have to stop at Walmart and pick up some supplies.

Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
Quote: Hearing voices no one else can hear isn't a good sign, even in the wizarding world.

Author: Joseph Stalin
Quote: A single death is a tragedy; a million deaths is a statistic.

Author: Leo Tolstoy
Quote: The best stories don't come from "good vs. bad"but "good vs. good.

Author: Norman Cousins
Quote: Death is not the greatest loss in life. The greatest loss is what dies inside us while we live.

Author: Bobby Brown
Quote: I feel that the simplicity of life is just being yourself.

Author: Ned Vizzini,  It's Kind of a Funny Story
Quote: Sometimes I just think depression's one way of coping with the world. Like, some people get drunk, some people do drugs, some people get depressed. Because there's so much stuff out there that you have to do something to deal with it.

Author: Jonathan Safran Foer,  Extremely Loud and Incredibly Close
Quote: The mistakes I've made are dead to me. But I can't take back the things I never did.

Author: William Stafford
Quote: Wisdom is having things right in your lifeand knowing why.

Author: John Green,  The Fault in Our Stars
Quote: If you don't live a life in service of a greater good, you've gotta at least die a death in service of a greater good, you know? And I fear that I won't get either a life or a death that means anything.

Author: Anne Rice,  Interview with the Vampire
Quote: The world changes, we do not, therein lies the irony that kills us.

Author: Amit Ray,  Meditation: Insights and Inspirations
Quote: It does not matter how long you are spending on the earth, how much money you have gathered or how much attention you have received. It is the amount of positive vibration you have radiated in life that matters,

Author: Jason Mraz
Quote: It’s strange how dreams get under your skin and give your heart a test for what’s real and what’s imaginary.

Author: D.H. Lawrence,  Lady Chatterley's Lover
Quote: It's no good trying to get rid of your own aloneness. You've got to stick to it all your life. Only at times, at times, the gap will be filled in. At times! But you have to wait for the times. Accept your own aloneness and stick to it, all your life. And then accept the times when the gap is filled in, when they come. But they've got to come. You can't force them.

Author: Shauna Niequist,  Bittersweet: Thoughts on Change, Grace, and Learning the Hard Way
Quote: It's not hard to decide what you want your life to be about. What's hard, she said, is figuring out what you're willing to give up in order to do the things you really care about.

Author: Harry Connick, Jr.
Quote: It is really rare to find someone you really, really love and that you want to spend your life with and all that stuff that goes along with being married. I am one of those lucky people. And I think she feels that way too. So the romantic stuff is easy because you want them to be happy.

Author: Nick Hornby,  A Long Way Down
Quote: Hard is trying to rebuild yourself, piece by piece, with no instruction book, and no clue as to where all the important bits are supposed to go.

Author: Dave Eggers
Quote: We are unusual and tragic and alive.

Author: Nicholas Sparks,  Three Weeks With My Brother
Quote: Never forget that anticipation is an important part of life. Work's important, family's important, but without excitement, you have nothing. You're cheating yourself if you refuse to enjoy what's coming.

Author: George Gordon Byron
Quote: Those who will not reason, are bigots, those who cannot, are fools, and those who dare not, are slaves.

Author: Wendell Berry,  Farming: a hand book
Quote: Don't own so much clutter that you will be relieved to see your house catch fire.

Author: Graham Greene,  Ways Of Escape
Quote: Writing is a form of therapy; sometimes I wonder how all those who do not write, compose, or paint can manage to escape the madness, melancholia, the panic and fear which is inherent in a human situation.

Author: Kurt Cobain
Quote: There are a lot of things I wish I would have done, instead of just sitting around and complaining about having a boring life.

Author: Milan Kundera,  The Unbearable Lightness of Being
Quote: And therein lies the whole of man's plight. Human time does not turn in a circle; it runs ahead in a straight line. That is why man cannot be happy: happiness is the longing for repetition.

Author: Maya Angelou,  Letter to My Daughter
Quote: I am convinced that most people do not grow up...We marry and dare to have children and call that growing up. I think what we do is mostly grow old. We carry accumulation of years in our bodies, and on our faces, but generally our real selves, the children inside, are innocent and shy as magnolias.

Author: Alan Alda
Quote: Be brave enough to live life creatively. The creative place where no one else has ever been.

Author: Pramoedya Ananta Toer,  Bumi Manusia
Quote: Berterimakasihlah pada segala yang memberi kehidupan.

Author: Ayn Rand,  Atlas Shrugged
Quote: Let me give you a tip on a clue to men's characters: the man who damns money has obtained it dishonorably; the man who respects it has earned it.

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: I won't tell you that the world matters nothing, or the world's voice, or the voice of society. They matter a good deal. They matter far too much. But there are moments when one has to choose between living one's own life, fully, entirely, completely—or dragging out some false, shallow, degrading existence that the world in its hypocrisy demands. You have that moment now. Choose!

Author: Katharine Hepburn,  Me: Stories of My Life
Quote: Life is hard. After all, it kills you.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: My past has not defined me, destroyed me, deterred me, or defeated me; it has only strengthened me.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  A Story That Talks about Talking Is Like Chatter to Chattering Teeth, and Every Set of Dentures Can Attest to the Fact That No..
Quote: I would pour you a glass of wine, but wouldn’t it be more romantic if you sipped it out of my armpit?

Author: Jennifer Aniston
Quote: I think it's important to have closure in any relationship that ends - from a romantic relationship to a friendship. You should always have a sense of clarity at the end and know why it began and why it ended. You need that in your life to move cleanly into your next phase.

Author: Brene Brown
Quote: Why, when we know that there's no such thing as perfect, do most of us spend an incredible amount of time and energy trying to be everything to everyone? Is it that we really admire perfection? No - the truth is that we are actually drawn to people who are real and down-to-earth. We love authenticity and we know that life is messy and imperfect.

Author: Ludwig Wittgenstein
Quote: I don't know why we are here, but I'm pretty sure that it is not in order to enjoy ourselves.

Author: Shel Silverstein,  Where the Sidewalk Ends: The Poems and Drawings of Shel Silverstein
Quote: EARLY BIRDOh, if you’re a bird, be an early birdAnd catch the worm for your breakfast plate.If you’re a bird, be an early early bird--But if you’re a worm, sleep late.

Author: Sarah Dessen,  Along for the Ride
Quote: It didn't make you noble to step away from something that wasn't working, even if you thought you were the reason for the malfunction. Especially then. It just made you a quitter. Because if you were the problem, chances were you could also be the solution. The only way to find out was to take another shot.

Author: Brian Tracy
Quote: It doesn't matter where you are coming from. All that matters is where you are going.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: In the land of Gibberish, the man who makes sense, the man who speaks clearly, clearly speaks nonsense.

Author: Cormac McCarthy,  The Road
Quote: Just remember that the things you put into your head are there forever, he said. You might want to think about that.You forget some things, dont you?Yes. You forget what you want to remember and you remember what you want to forget.

Author: J.D. Stroube,  Caged by Damnation
Quote: Life is filled with unanswered questions, but it is the courage to seek those answers that continues to give meaning to life. You can spend your life wallowing in despair, wondering why you were the one who was led towards the road strewn with pain, or you can be grateful that you are strong enough to survive it.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  Love quotes for the ages. Specifically ages 18-81.
Quote: I don’t want to make love last, I want to make love second to last. The last thing we’ll do is cuddle.

Author: محمد بن إدريس الشافعي
Quote: من نمّ لك نمّ بك, ومن نقل إليك نقل عنك, ومن إذا أرضيته فقال ماليس فيك, كذلك إذا أغضبته قال فيك ماليس فيك.

Author: Libba Bray
Quote: But we can't go back. We can only go forward.

Author: Skylar Grey
Quote: Your personal life, your professional life, and your creative life are all intertwined. I went through a few very difficult years where I felt like a failure. But it was actually really important for me to go through that. Struggle, for me, is the most inspirational thing in the world at the end of the day - as long as you treat it that way.

Author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.
Quote: Let the refining and improving of your own life keep you so busy that you have little time to criticize others.

Author: Mario Puzo,  Fools Die
Quote: Do you believe a man can truly love a woman and constantly betray her?Never mind physically but betray her in his mind,in the very "poetry of his soul".Well,it's not easy but men do it all the time.

Author: Chuck Palahniuk,  Snuff
Quote: It can only take a moment to waste the rest of your life.

Author: Jane Green,  Bookends
Quote: ... you don't have to wait for someone to treat you bad repeatedly. All it takes is once, and if they get away with it that once, if they know they can treat you like that, then it sets the pattern for the future.

Author: Slavoj Žižek
Quote: Cinema is the ultimate pervert art. It doesn't give you what you desire - it tells you how to desire.

Author: Ayn Rand,  The Fountainhead
Quote: To sell your soul is the easiest thing in the world. That's what everybody does every hour of his life. If I asked you to keep your soul - would you understand why that's much harder?

Author: Jarod Kintz,  99 Cents For Some Nonsense
Quote: Between hello and goodbye is I love you.

Author: Charles Bukowski,  What Matters Most is How Well You Walk Through the Fire
Quote: I wish to weepbut sorrow isstupid.I wish to believebut belief is agraveyard.

Author: Jonathan Safran Foer,  Everything Is Illuminated
Quote: She was like a drowning person, flailing, reaching for anything that might save her. Her life was an urgent, desperate struggle to justify her life.

Author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
Quote: What sweetness is left in life, if you take away friendship? Robbing life of friendship is like robbing the world of the sun. A true friend is more to be esteemed than kinsfolk.

Author: W. Clement Stone
Quote: Have the courage to say no. Have the courage to face the truth. Do the right thing because it is right. These are the magic keys to living your life with integrity.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: Want to keep Christ in Christmas? Feed the hungry, clothe the naked, forgive the guilty, welcome the unwanted, care for the ill, love your enemies, and do unto others as you would have done unto you.

Author: Bob Dylan
Quote: Life is more or less a lie, but then again, that's exactly the way we want it to be.

Author: Danny Kaye
Quote: Life is a blank canvas, and you need to throw all the paint on it you can.

Author: Ian McEwan,  Atonement
Quote: The cost of oblivious daydreaming was always this moment of return, the realignment with what had been before and now seemed a little worse.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: People who lack the clarity, courage, or determination to follow their own dreams will often find ways to discourage yours. When you change for the better, the people around you will be inspired to change also....but only after doing their best to make you stop. Live your truth and don't EVER stop.

Author: Heinrich Heine
Quote: We should forgive our enemies, but not before they are hanged

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: In case you never get a second chance: don't be afraid!""And what if you do get a second chance?""You take it!

Author: Jarod Kintz,  I Want
Quote: I want to create a seventeen-syllable word that encompasses the human condition, and then use that word to form the world’s most perfect haiku.

Author: Sarah Dessen,  The Truth About Forever
Quote: But that was the problem with having the answers. It was only after you gave them that you realized they sometimes weren't what people wanted to hear.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: Life is a succession of lessons which must be lived to be understood.

Author: Marla Gibbs
Quote: In my life I've learned that true happiness comes from giving. Helping others along the way makes you evaluate who you are. I think that love is what we're all searching for. I haven't come across anyone who didn't become a better person through love.

Author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow,  Ballads and Other Poems
Quote: Be still, sad heart! and cease repining;Behind the clouds is the sun still shining;Thy fate is the common fate of all,Into each life some rain must fall

Author: Woody Allen
Quote: Life is full of misery, loneliness, and suffering - and it's all over much too soon.

Author: Abraham Lincoln
Quote: The best way to predict your future is to create it

Author: Matthew Arnold,  Dover Beach and Other Poems
Quote: Ah, love, let us be true To one another! for the world, which seems To lie before us like a land of dreams, So various, so beautiful, so new, Hath really neither joy, nor love, nor light, Nor certitude, nor peace, nor help for pain; And we are here as on a darkling plain Swept with confused alarms of struggle and flight, Where ignorant armies clash by night.

Author: Hilaire Belloc
Quote: I have wandered all my life, and I have also traveled; the difference between the two being this, that we wander for distraction, but we travel for fulfillment.

Author: P.G. Wodehouse
Quote: He had the look of one who had drunk the cup of life and found a dead beetle at the bottom.

Author: Seán O'Casey
Quote: All the world's a stage and most of us are desperately unrehearsed.

Author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
Quote: I do not believe anyone can be perfectly well, who has a brain and a heart

Author: Julian Barnes,  Flaubert's Parrot
Quote: Books say: She did this because. Life says: She did this. Books are where things are explained to you; life is where things aren't. I'm not surprised some people prefer books. Books make sense of life. The only problem is that the lives they make sense of are other people's lives, never your own.

Author: Nicholas Sparks,  Nights in Rodanthe
Quote: Too many people seem to believe that silence was a void that needed to be filled, even if nothing important was said.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: You were put on this earth to achieve your greatest self, to live out your purpose, and to do it courageously.

Author: C.G. Jung
Quote: Mistakes are, after all, the foundations of truth, and if a man does not know what a thing is, it is at least an increase in knowledge if he knows what it is not.

Author: Hans Christian Andersen,  The Fairy Tale of My Life: An Autobiography
Quote: To move, to breathe, to fly, to float,To gain all while you give,To roam the roads of lands remote,To travel is to live.

Author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
Quote: Even with all our technology and the inventions that make modern life so much easier than it once was, it takes just one big natural disaster to wipe all that away and remind us that, here on Earth, we're still at the mercy of nature.

Author: Napoleon Hill,  Think and Grow Rich
Quote: When defeat comes, accept it as a signal that your plans are not sound, rebuild those plans, and set sail once more toward your coveted goal.

Author: Annie Dillard,  The Writing Life
Quote: How we spend our days is, of course, how we spend our lives.

Author: Cheryl Strayed,  Tiny Beautiful Things: Advice on Love and Life from Dear Sugar
Quote: I'll never know, and neither will you, of the life you don't choose. We'll only know that whatever that sister life was, it was important and beautiful and not ours. It was the ghost ship that didn't carry us. There's nothing to do but salute it from the shore.

Author: Ian McEwan,  On Chesil Beach
Quote: This is how the entire course of a life can be changed: by doing nothing.

Author: Norman Cousins
Quote: A library is the delivery room for the birth of ideas, a place where history comes to life.

Author: Gerard Way
Quote: Tears are words the heart can't express

Author: Rachel Vincent,  My Soul to Save
Quote: Chocolate says "I'm sorry"so much better than words.

Author: John Steinbeck
Quote: Power does not corrupt. Fear corrupts... perhaps the fear of a loss of power.

Author: Roger A. Caras
Quote: Dogs are not our whole life, but they make our lives whole.

Author: Neil Gaiman,  American Gods
Quote: I believe that life is a game, that life is a cruel joke, and that life is what happens when you're alive and that you might as well lie back and enjoy it.

Author: Brian Andreas
Quote: Wanting him to come back before anyone notices part of the world has not moved since he left.

Author: Joseph Campbell
Quote: If the path before you is clear, you're probably on someone else's.

Author: Patch Adams
Quote: You've got to know what you want. This is central to acting on your intentions. When you know what you want, you realize that all there is left then is time management. You'll manage your time to achieve your goals because you clearly know what you're trying to achieve in your life.

Author: Sylvia Plath,  The Unabridged Journals of Sylvia Plath
Quote: So much working, reading, thinking, living to do! A lifetime is not long enough.

Author: Jorge Luis Borges
Quote: You have wakened not out of sleep, but into a prior dream, and that dream lies within another, and so on, to infinity, which is the number of grains of sand. The path that you are to take is endless, and you will die before you have truly awakened.

Author: Colleen Hoover,  Slammed
Quote: Life happens. Shit happens. And it happens a lot. To a lot of people.

Author: Laini Taylor,  Daughter of Smoke & Bone
Quote: I know it's not easy for you, living this life, but try to remember, always try to remember, you're not the only one with troubles.

Author: John Lennon
Quote: When you do something noble and beautiful and nobody noticed, do not be sad. For the sun every morning is a beautiful spectacle and yet most of the audience still sleeps.

Author: Bohdi Sanders,  Warrior Wisdom: Ageless Wisdom for the Modern Warrior
Quote: Never respond to an angry person with a fiery comeback, even if he deserves it...Don't allow his anger to become your anger.

Author: Tom Hiddleston
Quote: We all have two lives. The second one starts when we realize that we only have one.

Author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
Quote: The clearest way to show what the rule of law means to us in everyday life is to recall what has happened when there is no rule of law.

Author: C.G. Jung
Quote: As far as we can discern, the sole purpose of human existence is to kindle a light of meaning in the darkness of mere being.

Author: Robert E. Howard
Quote: Civilized men are more discourteous than savages because they know they can be impolite without having their skulls split, as a general thing.

Author: Bill Watterson
Quote: Hobbes: Do you think there's a God?Calvin: Well, somebody's out to get me!

Author: Mark Twain,  Notebook
Quote: Obscurity and a competence—that is the life that is best worth living.

Author: Jess C. Scott,  EyeLeash: A Blog Novel
Quote: My head’ll explode if I continue with this escapism.

Author: Jane Austen,  Emma
Quote: One half of the world cannot understand the pleasures of the other.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: This life is for loving, sharing, learning, smiling, caring, forgiving, laughing, hugging, helping, dancing, wondering, healing, and even more loving. I choose to live life this way. I want to live my life in such a way that when I get out of bed in the morning, the devil says, 'aw shit, he's up!

Author: Jerry Spinelli,  Stargirl
Quote: When a stargirl cries, she sheds not tears but light.

Author: Pearl Bailey
Quote: There's a period of life when we swallow a knowledge of ourselves and it becomes either good or sour inside.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  Love quotes for the ages. Specifically ages 18-81.
Quote: I make love like the 13th floor is the 14th floor of a hotel. I give it that little extra that takes it to a whole new level.

Author: Kazuo Ishiguro,  Never Let Me Go
Quote: What I'm not sure about, is if our lives have been so different from the lives of the people we save. We all complete. Maybe none of us really understand what we've lived through, or feel we've had enough time.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: When you arise in the morning, think of what a precious privilege it is to be alive—to breathe, to think, to enjoy, to love—then make that day count!

Author: Christopher Hitchens,  Hitch-22: A Memoir
Quote: What do you most value in your friends?Their continued existence.

Author: Miguel Ruiz,  The Four Agreements: A Practical Guide to Personal Freedom
Quote: If others tell us something we make assumptions, and if they don't tell us something we make assumptions to fulfill our need to know and to replace the need to communicate. Even if we hear something and we don't understand we make assumptions about what it means and then believe the assumptions. We make all sorts of assumptions because we don't have the courage to ask questions.

Author: Albert Einstein
Quote: The tragedy of life is what dies inside a man while he lives.

Author: John Lubbock,  The Pleasures of Life
Quote: Art is unquestionably one of the purest and highest elements in human happiness. It trains the mind through the eye, and the eye through the mind. As the sun colors flowers, so does art color life.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  Love quotes for the ages. Specifically ages 18-81.
Quote: I’ve got a way with love. Away with love.

Author: Henry Rollins,  The Portable Henry Rollins
Quote: I definitely learned a lesson this time. I know that I can be broken. I am not as tough as I thought. I see it now. At this point, it's the only thing good that came out of all of this. I know myself better now and know what I have to do.

Author: Paulo Coelho,  By the River Piedra I Sat Down and Wept
Quote: We can never judge the lives of others, because each person knows only their own pain and renunciation.

Author: Henry Rollins
Quote: I am ready for whatever's coming. I expect nothing but to be let down or turned away. I am alone. Goddamn. The shit hurts sometimes, but I realize what I am, what I have become.

Author: John Webster
Quote: Whether we fall by ambition, blood, or lustLike diamonds we are cut with our own dust

Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
Quote: Life belongs to the living, and he who lives must be prepared for changes.

Author: Helen Keller
Quote: People don’t like to think, if one thinks, one must reach conclusions. Conclusions are not always pleasant.

Author: Robin S. Sharma,  The Monk Who Sold His Ferrari
Quote: Your "I CAN"is more important than your IQ.

Author: Garrison Keillor
Quote: I believe in looking reality straight in the eye and denying it.

Author: Charles Baudelaire
Quote: The beautiful is always bizarre.

Author: Ben Mendelsohn
Quote: I don't believe in the transformation myth, where if you have more success, life changes for you.

Author: Zora Neale Hurston
Quote: I have known the joy and pain of friendship. I have served and been served. I have made some good enemies for which I am not a bit sorry. I have loved unselfishly, and I have fondled hatred with the red-hot tongs of Hell. That's living.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: People wait around too long for love. I'm happy with all of my lusts!

Author: Jenny Han,  The Summer I Turned Pretty
Quote: Would you rather live one perfect day over and over or live your life with no perfect days but just decent ones?

Author: Louis Sachar
Quote: I'm not saying it's going to be easy. Nothing in life is easy. But that's no reason to give up. You'll be surprised what you can accomplish if you set your mind to it. After all, you only have one life, so you should try to make the most of it.

Author: D. Simone
Quote: May Light always surround you;Hope kindle and rebound you.May your Hurts turn to Healing;Your Heart embrace Feeling.May Wounds become Wisdom;Every Kindness a Prism.May Laughter infect you;Your Passion resurrect you.May Goodness inspire your Deepest Desires.Through all that you Reach For, May your arms Never Tire.

Author: Cassandra Clare,  Clockwork Princess
Quote: One does no question miracles, or complain that they are no constructed perfectly to one's liking.

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche
Quote: Is life not a thousand times too short for us to bore ourselves?

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Love flows like flowers, and grows like water. I’m so thirsty for romance I could drink a dozen roses.

Author: Eleanor Robson Belmont
Quote: Never be afraid to meet to the hilt the demand of either work, or friendship - two of life's major assets.

Author: Woody Allen
Quote: My one regret in life is that I am not someone else.

Author: Shannon L. Alder
Quote: Every woman that finally figured out her worth, has picked up her suitcases of pride and boarded a flight to freedom, which landed in the valley of change.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: 0 plus 100 equals 100. But so does 50 plus 50, only with more balance. Let this be a lesson in love.

Author: Sean Mangan
Quote: Life is too short when you think of the length of death

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: The reason many people in our society are miserable, sick, and highly stressed is because of an unhealthy attachment to things they have no control over.

Author: Thomas Hardy,  The Mayor of Casterbridge
Quote: Happiness was but the occasional episode in a general drama of pain.

Author: Yevgeny Zamyatin,  We
Quote: A man is like a novel: until the very last page you don't know how it will end. Otherwise it wouldn't be worth reading.

Author: Jane Austen,  Persuasion
Quote: How quick come the reasons for approving what we like.

Author: Hugh Prather
Quote: Just when I think I have learned the way to live, life changes.

Author: أحمد خالد توفيق
Quote: لكن دعني أخبرك بشيء مهم ,لا تقض حياتك بإنتظار أن تنتهي الفترة كذا و الفترة كذا ..أن تنتهي فترة الدراسة .. أن تنتهي فترة التجنيد الإجباري .. أن تنتهي فترة انتدابك في كينيا .. إلخ لسوف تجد أن حياتك صارت مجموعة من الفترات يجب أن تنتهي و هوب! تكتشف أنك بلغت نهاية العمر ولما تنعم بحياتك يوما واحدا ..يجب أن تستمتع بكل فترة كأنها هي الصورة الوحيدة النهائية لحياتك ..

Author: Sarah Dessen,  The Truth About Forever
Quote: The choices you make now, the people you surround yourself with, they all have the potential to affect your life, even who you are, forever.

Author: Philip K. Dick,  Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep?
Quote: You will be required to do wrong no matter where you go. It is the basic condition of life, to be required to violate your own identity. At some time, every creature which lives must do so. It is the ultimate shadow, the defeat of creation; this is the curse at work, the curse that feeds on all life. Everywhere in the universe.

Author: Drew Carey
Quote: Oh, you hate your job? Why didn't you say so?There's a support group for that. It's called EVERYBODY, and they meet at the bar.

Author: Margaret Peterson Haddix,  Among the Brave
Quote: Maybe everyone is just waiting for someone else to save them.

Author: Walker Percy,  The Second Coming
Quote: You can get all A's and still flunk life.

Author: Arthur Golden,  Memoirs of a Geisha
Quote: We lead our lives like water flowing down a hill, going more or less in one direction until we splash into something that forces us to find a new course.

Author: Daphne du Maurier,  Rebecca
Quote: I suppose sooner or later in the life of everyone comes a moment of trial. We all of us have our particular devil who rides us and torments us, and we must give battle in the end.

Author: Albert Camus,  The Myth of Sisyphus and Other Essays
Quote: What is called a reason for living is also an excellent reason for dying.

Author: Paulo Coelho
Quote: Life was always a matter of waiting for the right moment to act.

Author: Confucius
Quote: Give a bowl of rice to a man and you will feed him for a day. Teach him how to grow his own rice and you will save his life.

Author: Dark Jar Tin Zoo,  Love Quotes for the Ages. Specifically Ages 19-91.
Quote: To find out if she really loved me, I hooked her up to a lie detector. And just as I suspected, my machine was broken.

Author: Joan Didion,  On Self-Respect
Quote: Character — the willingness to accept responsibility for one's own life — is the source from which self-respect springs.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: My brain is divided into two butterflies, and both are in love with your rose-shaped heart. If you've got the garden, I've got my whole life.

Author: J.A. Konrath
Quote: One of the greatest journeys in life is overcoming insecurity and learning to truly not give a shit.

Author: Jim Morrison
Quote: I think the highest and lowest points are the important ones. Anything else is just...in between.

Author: Gustave Flaubert
Quote: One can be the master of what one does, but never of what one feels.

Author: Sarah Kay
Quote: Life will hit you hard in the face, wait for you to get back up just so it can kick you in the stomach. But getting the wind knocked out of you is the only way to remind your lungs how much they like the taste of air.

Author: Ann Brashares
Quote: I'm afraid of time... I mean, I'm afraid of not having enough time. Not enough time to understand people, how they really are, or to be understood myself. I'm afraid of the quick judgements or mistakes everybody makes. You can't fix them without time. I'm afraid of seeing snapshots, not movies.

Author: Charlotte Brontë,  Jane Eyre
