Author: Sarah Dessen,  The Truth About Forever
Quote: As for me, I was just trying to get it right, whatever that means. But now I finally felt I was on my way. Everyone had a forever, but given a choice, this would be mine. The one that began in this moment, with Wes, in a kiss that took my breath away, then gave it back - leaving meastounded, amazed and most of all, alive.

Author: Tonya Hurley,  Ghostgirl
Quote: Life sucks, then you die. Then it sucks again.

Author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Sr.
Quote: It's faith in something and enthusiasm for something that makes a life worth living.

Author: Philip Pullman,  The Amber Spyglass
Quote: We shouldn't live as if [other worlds] mattered more than this life in this world, because where we are is always the most important place.

Author: Woody Allen,  Without Feathers
Quote: Money is better than poverty, if only for financial reasons.

Author: Brené Brown,  The Gifts of Imperfection: Let Go of Who You Think You're Supposed to Be and Embrace Who You Are
Quote: When we fail to set boundaries and hold people accountable, we feel used and mistreated. This is why we sometimes attack who they are, which is far more hurtful than addressing a behavior or a choice.

Author: Gayle Forman,  If I Stay
Quote: And now I am here, as alone as I've ever been. I am seventeen years old. This is not how it's suppose to be. This is not how my life is suppose to turn out.

Author: Joe L. Wheeler
Quote: There is something incredibly nostalgic and significant about the annual cascade of autumn leaves.

Author: Elizabeth Scott,  The Unwritten Rule
Quote: There are a million rules for being a girl. There are a million things you have to do to get through each day. High school has things that can trip you up, ruin you, people say one thing and mean another, and you have to know all the rules, you have to know what you can and can't do.

Author: Joelle Charbonneau,  The Testing
Quote: Things don't always work out the way we hope. You just have to pick yourself up and find a new direction to go in.

Author: Lisa Kleypas,  Sugar Daddy
Quote: The span of three or four minutes is pretty insignificant in the scheme of things. People lose hundreds of minutes everyday, squandering them on trivial things. But sometimes in those fragments of time, something can happen you'll remember the rest of your life.

Author: Erol Ozan
Quote: Some beautiful paths can't be discovered without getting lost.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: I'm hanging on to her memory like Spanish moss on an ancient Florida oak, and unlike the sunset, my love won't fade.

Author: Lisa Kleypas,  Sugar Daddy
Quote: You have to rely on whatever sparks you have inside.

Author: Charlotte Eriksson
Quote: I haven’t been very impressed lately.By people,or places,or the way someone said he loved me and then slowly changed his mind.

Author: Lisa Schroeder,  I Heart You, You Haunt Me
Quote: Guilt reminds me of a stray cat. You chase it away and yet, it comes back when you least expect it. If you let yourself feel pity for it and feed the thing, it parks its ugly, puny, lonely-for-attention butt on your doormat and won't go away. Scat kitty cat, scat. I don't need you sitting around here like that.

Author: Sloane Crosley,  I Was Told There'd Be Cake
Quote: Life starts out with everyone clapping when you take a poo and goes downhill from there.

Author: Brian Tracy
Quote: If you wish to achieve worthwhile things in your personal and career life, you must become a worthwhile person in your own self-development.

Author: Michael Chabon
Quote: The whole house seemed to exhale a melancholy breath of emptiness

Author: Brian Tracy
Quote: Always choose the future over the past. What do we do now?

Author: Bob Dylan
Quote: I define nothing. Not beauty, not patriotism. I take each thing as it is, without prior rules about what it should be.

Author: Tana French,  In the Woods
Quote: What I am telling you, before you begin my story, is this -- two things: I crave truth. And I lie.

Author: T.S. Eliot
Quote: There is one who remembers the way to your door: Life you may evade, but Death you shall not.

Author: Robert A. Heinlein,  Have Space Suit—Will Travel
Quote: Some people insist that 'mediocre' is better than 'best.' They delight in clipping wings because they themselves can't fly. They despise brains because they have none.

Author: Johnny Depp
Quote: People say I make strange choices, but they’re not strange for me. My sickness is that I’m fascinated by human behavior, by what’s underneath the surface, by the worlds inside people.

Author: Og Mandino
Quote: Realize that true happiness lies within you. Waste no time and effort searching for peace and contentment and joy in the world outside. Remember that there is no happiness in having or in getting, but only in giving. Reach out. Share. Smile. Hug. Happiness is a perfume you cannot pour on others without getting a few drops on yourself.

Author: Charles de Lint,  Dreams Underfoot
Quote: There are no happy endings... There are no endings, happy or otherwise. We all have our own stories which are just part of the one Story that binds both this world and Faerie. Sometimes we step into each others stories - perhaps just for a few minutes, perhaps for years - and then we step out of them again. But all the while, the Story just goes on.

Author: Scott Westerfeld,  Pretties
Quote: At least one thing was consistent about her life: It just kept on getting more complicated.

Author: Cesar Chavez
Quote: It is possible to become discouraged about the injustice we see everywhere. But God did not promise us that the world would be humane and just. He gives us the gift of life and allows us to choose the way we will use our limited time on earth. It is an awesome opportunity.

Author: Craig Silvey,  Jasper Jones
Quote: I don't understand a thing about this world: about people, and why they do the things they do. The more I find out, the more I uncover, the more I know, the less I understand.

Author: John Steinbeck,  The Grapes of Wrath
Quote: Muscles aching to work, minds aching to create - this is man.

Author: Iimani David
Quote: Love changes things; hope allows us to endure until the change arrives.

Author: Fran Lebowitz
Quote: Life is something that happens when you can't get to sleep.

Author: Virginia Woolf,  Orlando
Quote: He who robs us of our dreams robs us of our life.

Author: Rick Riordan,  The Blood of Olympus
Quote: A wind that blows aimlessly is no good to anyone.

Author: Santosh Kalwar,  Quote Me Everyday
Quote: Wake up, Shake up, Make up and Break up; life is all about moving like ant in search of sugar not sand.

Author: Paul Murray,  Skippy Dies
Quote: Life makes fools of all of us sooner or later. But keep your sense of humor and you'll at least be able to take your humiliations with some measure of grace. In the end, you know, its our own expectations that crush us.

Author: Maggie Stiefvater,  Linger
Quote: Life's pain. You just have to get over as much of it as you can.-Isabel Culpeper

Author: Craig Ferguson,  American on Purpose: The Improbable Adventures of an Unlikely Patriot
Quote: I think when you become a parent you go from being a star in the movie of your own life to the supporting player in the movie of someone else's.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: I was in love one time, I said as I held up my pinky. I would have held up my index finger, but I wasn't in love that long.

Author: Carl Sagan
Quote: A celibate clergy is an especially good idea, because it tends to suppress any hereditary propensity toward fanaticism.

Author: David Brin
Quote: It is said that power corrupts, but actually it's more true that power attracts the corruptible. The sane are usually attracted by other things than power.

Author: Amit Ray
Quote: The true miracle lies in our eagerness to allow, appreciate, and honor the uniqueness, and freedom of each sentient being to sing the song of their heart.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: I’m learning to play the saxophone so when you feel lonely I can come over and stand in the shadows and play it for you. Two is one too lonely for me.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: Anything that you learn becomes your wealth, a wealth that cannot be taken away from you; whether you learn it in a building called school or in the school of life. To learn something new is a timeless pleasure and a valuable treasure. And not all things that you learn are taught to you, but many things that you learn you realize you have taught yourself.

Author: Bill Watterson
Quote: HOBBES:If you don't get a goodnight kiss you get Kafka dreams.

Author: Joe Abercrombie,  Last Argument of Kings
Quote: If you want to be a new man you have to stay in new places, and do new things, with people who never knew you before. If you go back to the same old ways, what else can you be but the same old person?

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: As soon as you cross the county line into where all the wealthier people live, the weather is suddenly sunnier and warmer. Even at night.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Take some cues from some Q’s. Quality and quantity lead to queues.

Author: Morrissey
Quote: Now this might disturb you, but I find I'm OK by myself;and I don't need you or your benevolence to make sense.

Author: Becca Fitzpatrick,  Silence
Quote: Anything was better than nothing. Half-full was better than empty. Ignorance was the lowest form of humiliation and suffering.

Author: Khaled Hosseini
Quote: and every day I thank [God] that I am alive, not because I fear death, but because my wife has a husband and my son is not an orphan.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: If I found 20 dollars on the ground, I’d be willing to bet I’d find someone in desperate need of money that I could give it to. And I’d bet 20 dollars, so even after finding and giving away 20 dollars, I’d have made 20 dollars.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Reading makes you ready for the world. A man who doesn’t read is a man who is easily deceived. You must find that man and make him sign a contract, and you must do it before Satan does. Trust me, the profits are HUGE!

Author: Arthur Rimbaud,  Une saison en enfer; Illuminations; et autres textes
Quote: Life is the farce we are all forced to endure.

Author: Leo Buscaglia
Quote: Life is a paradise for those who love many things with a passion.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book Title is Invisible
Quote: My next breath may very well be in your lungs. Store it wisely, because my life depends on it.

Author: Rudyard Kipling,  The Light That Failed
Quote: You must learn to forgive a man when he's in love. He's always a nuisance.

Author: Ashly Lorenzana
Quote: People leave imprints on our lives, shaping who we become in much the same way that a symbol is pressed into the page of a book to tell you who it comes from. Dogs, however, leave paw prints on our lives and our souls, which are as unique as fingerprints in every way.

Author: Alex Harris
Quote: Being faithful in the smallest things is the way to gain, maintain, and demonstrate the strength needed to accomplish something great.

Author: Ellen DeGeneres
Quote: Things will get easier, people's minds will change, and you should be alive to see it.

Author: Brian Tracy
Quote: All successful people men and women are big dreamers. They imagine what their future could be, ideal in every respect, and then they work every day toward their distant vision, that goal or purpose.

Author: Anonymous,  Bhagavad Gita: El Canto del Senor
Quote: The power of God is with you at all times; through the activities of mind, senses, breathing, and emotions; and is constantly doing all the work using you as a mere instrument.

Author: Sarah Dessen
Quote: After all, it's all kinds of things that make up a life, right? The big, like falling in love and spending time with your family, and the little....like blow drying your hair, applying concealer, and cursing those magazine inserts. It all counts. It has to.

Author: Stephen King
Quote: A lot of us grow up and we grow out of the literal interpretation that we get when we're children, but we bear the scars all our life. Whether they're scars of beauty or scars of ugliness, it's pretty much in the eye of the beholder.

Author: Robert A. Heinlein
Quote: May you live as long as you wish and love as long as you live.

Author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau
Quote: Or, rather, let us be more simple and less vain.

Author: Jim Butcher,  Vignette
Quote: Pain is a byproduct of life. That’s the truth. Life sometimes sucks. That’s true for everyone. But if you don’t face the pain and the suck, you don’t ever get the other things either. Laughter. Joy. Love. Pain passes, but those things are worth fighting for. Worth dying for.

Author: Sophie Kinsella,  Confessions of a Shopaholic
Quote: Rule of life. If you bother to ask someone’s advice, then bother to listen to it.

Author: Ai Yazawa
Quote: The longer we live, the more weight we carry in our hearts.

Author: Orhan Pamuk,  The Museum of Innocence
Quote: Any intelligent person knows that life is a beautiful thing and that the purpose of life is to be happy,"said my father as he watched the three beauties. "But it seems only idiots are ever happy. How can we explain this?

Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
Quote: If you would create something,you must be something.

Author: Laurell K. Hamilton,  Guilty Pleasures
Quote: It is a very natural human trait to destroy that which frightens us.

Author: Martin Luther King Jr.
Quote: Occasionally in life there are those moments of unutterable fulfillment which cannot be completely explained by those symbols called words. Their meanings can only be articulated by the inaudible language of the heart.

Author: Alain de Botton
Quote: There is no such thing as work-life balance. Everything worth fighting for unbalances your life.

Author: Hazrat Ali Ibn Abu-Talib A.S
Quote: Life consists of two days, one for you one against you. So when it's for you don't be proud or reckless, and when it's against you be patient, for both days are test for you.

Author: Pearl S. Buck
Quote: I feel no need for any other faith than my faith in the kindness of human beings. I am so absorbed in the wonder of earth and the life upon it that I cannot think of heaven and angels.

Author: William Shakespeare,  Macbeth
Quote: Out, out brief candle, life is but a walking shadow...a tale told by an idiot, full of sound and fury, signifying nothing.

Author: David Rossi
Quote: Scars show us where we have been, they do not dictate where we are going.

Author: David Levithan,  Boy Meets Boy
Quote: But I think we both knew, even then, that what we had was something even more rare, and even more meaningful. I was going to be his friend, and was going to show him possibilities. And he, in turn, would become someone I could trust more than myself.

Author: Edgar Allan Poe,  The Mystery of Marie Rogêt
Quote: Experience has shown, and a true philosophy will always show, that a vast, perhaps the larger, portion of truth arises from the seemingly irrelevant.

Author: J.D. Salinger,  The Catcher in the Rye
Quote: It's such a stupid question, in my opinion. I mean, how do you know what you're going to do till you do it? The answer is, you don't. I think I am, but how do I know? I swear it's a stupid question.

Author: Nikola Tesla
Quote: Life is and will ever remain an equation incapable of solution, but it contains certain known factors.

Author: Hayley Williams
Quote: Now I've gone for too longLiving like I'm not aliveSo I'm going to start over tonightBeginning with you and I

Author: ياسر حارب,  على لسان الطائر الأزرق
Quote: عندما تُسامح فإنك تتنازل عن غضبك للآخرين

Author: Seneca
Quote: Life is like a play: it's not the length, but the excellence of the acting that matters.

Author: Nicole McKay,  I Had a Dream About You
Quote: I had a dream about you last night.. you were holding a pine cone and introducing him as Gerald.

Author: Harper Lee
Quote: As you grow up, always tell the truth, do no harm to others, and don't think you are the most important being on earth. Rich or poor, you then can look anyone in the eye and say, 'I'm probably no better than you, but I'm certainly your equal.

Author: Lana Del Rey
Quote: Distance sometimes lets you know who is worth keeping, and who is worth letting go.

Author: Leo Tolstoy,  War and Peace
Quote: Life did not stop, and one had to live.

Author: Banana Yoshimoto,  NP
Quote: Everything that had happened was shockingly beautiful, enough to make you crazy.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: It’s a lack of clarity that creates chaos and frustration. Those emotions are poison to any living goal.

Author: Gena Showalter,  Oh My Goth
Quote: How does fear become so powerful? We can’t see it. We can’t touch it, yet it gets its claws in us and begins to control us. Sigh. I hate feeling afraid, and I hate, hate, HATE feeling out of control.

Author: Richard Paul Evans,  The Gift
Quote: I've come to know that what we want in life is the greatest indication of who we really are.

Author: Dale Evans
Quote: Life is not over because you have diabetes. Make the most of what you have, be grateful.

Author: François de La Rochefoucauld,  Maxims
Quote: One cannot answer for his courage when he has never been in danger.

Author: Masashi Kishimoto
Quote: One day you will be the one called Master (Naruto). You'll be the one to treat others to ramen. We can't stay kids forever."- Shikamaru Nara (Naruto)

Author: J.M. Darhower,  Sempre
Quote: You can play it safe, and I wouldn't blame you for it. You can continue as you've been doing, and you'll survive, but is that what you want? Is that enough?

Author: Gena Showalter,  Oh My Goth
Quote: There are two kinds of people,’ she’d said. ‘Those who coast through life like ducks in a row, following one after the other, and those who ride the waves.’” Tears spilled down my cheeks, and my voice cracked. “‘Ride the waves, baby, and live. Live.

Author: John Eldredge,  Captivating: Unveiling the Mystery of a Woman's Soul
Quote: We think you'll find that every woman in her heart of hearts longs for three things: to be romanced, to play an irreplaceable role in a great adventure, and to unveil beauty. That's what makes a woman come alive.

Author: Brené Brown
Quote: If you own this story you get to write the ending.

Author: Charlotte Brontë,  Shirley
Quote: God surely did not create us, and cause us to live, with the sole end of wishing always to die. I believe, in my heart, we were intended to prize life and enjoy it, so long as we retain it. Existence never was originally meant to be that useless, blank, pale, slow-trailing thing it often becomes to many, and is becoming to me, among the rest.

Author: Jay Asher,  Thirteen Reasons Why
Quote: Maybe if I forgot things once in a while, we'd all be a little bit happier.

Author: Paulo Coelho,  Brida
Quote: When we set out on the path, we always have a fairly clear idea of what we hope to find. Women are generally seeking their Soul Mate, and men looking for Power. Neither party is really interested in learning. They simply want to reach the thing they have set as their goal.

Author: Santosh Kalwar,  Quote Me Everyday
Quote: There are two ways to live a life either forget everything or, remember nothing.

Author: Michael Cunningham,  The Hours
Quote: Dead, we are revealed in our true dimensions, and they are surprisingly modest.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: When you are living the best version of yourself, you inspire others to live the best versions of themselves.

Author: John Green,  Paper Towns
Quote: Life has become the future. Every moment of your life is lived for the future.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Tweeting is talking into the abyss, filling a void in your life by avoiding real human contact.

Author: Gautama Buddha
Quote: May all that have life be delivered from suffering

Author: Jeanette Winterson
Quote: The continuous narrative of existence is a lie. There is no continuous narrative, there are lit-up moments, and the rest is dark.

Author: Laurie Halse Anderson,  Speak
Quote: A little kid asks my dad why that man is chopping down the tree.Dad: He's not chopping it down. He's saving it. Those branches were long dead from disease. All plants are like that. By cutting off the damage you make it possible for the tree to grow again. You watch - by the end of summer, this tree will be the strongest on the block.

Author: John Green,  An Abundance of Katherines
Quote: I just want to do something that matters. Or be something that matters. I just want to matter.

Author: Patricia Briggs,  When Demons Walk
Quote: The only certainty life contains is death.

Author: Junot Díaz,  The Brief Wondrous Life of Oscar Wao
Quote: You can't regret the life you didn't lead.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Love is a boomerang dripped in honey, in that it emanates from me just as surely as it will return to me. Still, I think I’d much rather wash my hands and be done with it.

Author: Henry David Thoreau
Quote: Wealth is the ability to fully experience life.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  The Days of Yay are Here! Wake Me Up When They're Over.
Quote: I have good news and I have bad news. The good news is that your house hasn't burned down, you don't have cancer, and your daughter hasn't been raped or murdered. The bad news is that I ran over your dog. And your son. And his wife. But not before I ran out of gas to achieve all of that.

Author: Bill Watterson,  The Complete Calvin and Hobbes
Quote: Isn't it sad how some people's grip on their lives is so precarious that they'll embrace any preposterous delusion rather than face an occasional bleak truth?

Author: Ashly Lorenzana
Quote: Sooner or later in life, we will all take our own turn being in the position we once had someone else in.

Author: Suzanne Collins,  Catching Fire
Quote: Because, sometimes, things happen to people and they're not equipped to deal with them.

Author: John Green,  Looking for Alaska
Quote: It is worth it to leave behing my minor life for grander maybes-Miles "Pudge

Author: Susane Colasanti,  When It Happens
Quote: For one day there will be nothing left, yet we will have something. -me-I tried to wait for my life to begin. Something has to happen. Like an amazing boy. I know he's out there. I just have to find him.

Author: Colleen Hoover,  Slammed
Quote: Sometimes life doesn't happen in chronological order.

Author: Emilie Autumn
Quote: My reasons to liveWere my reasons to dieBut at least they were mineNow I've freedom unboundCut the laces of life

Author: Gilles Deleuze,  A Thousand Plateaus: Capitalism and Schizophrenia
Quote: Bring something incomprehensible into the world!

Author: Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni
Quote: Let yourself be open and life will be easier. A spoon of salt in a glass of water makes the water undrinkable. A spoon of salt in a lake is almost unnoticed.

Author: Samuel Beckett
Quote: No, I regret nothing, all I regret is having been born, dying is such a long tiresome business I always found.

Author: Beyoncé Knowles
Quote: I'm always happy when I'm surrounded by water, I think I'm a Mermaid or I was a mermaid.The ocean makes me feel really small and it makes me put my whole life into perspective… it humbles you and makes you feel almost like you’ve been baptized. I feel born again when I get out of the ocean.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Nobody sleeps at the Inn of Innovation. You don't wake up, but you do #startup.

Author: Chuck Palahniuk,  Fight Club
Quote: Skinny guys fight till they're burger.

Author: Douglas Coupland,  Generation X: Tales for an Accelerated Culture
Quote: When someone tells you they’ve just bought a house, they might as well tell you they no longer have a personality. You can immediately assume so many things: that they’re locked into jobs they hate; that they’re broke; that they spend every night watching videos; that they’re fifteen pounds overweight; that they no longer listen to new ideas. It’s profoundly depressing.

Author: Cristina Marrero
Quote: We never know when our last day on earth will be. So, love with full sincerity, believe with true faith, and hope with all of your might. Better to have lived in truth and discovered life, than to have lived half heartedly and died long before you ever ceased breathing.

Author: Tom Upton,  Just Plain Weird
Quote: ...Life is much simpler if you don’t notice anything....

Author: Christopher Paolini,  Inheritance
Quote: It's impossible to go through life unscathed. Nor should you want to. By the hurts we accumulate, we measure both our follies and our accomplishments.

Author: Deb Caletti,  Stay
Quote: You can forget that other people carry pieces of your own story around in their heads. I've always thought--put together all those random pieces form everyone who's ever known you from your parents to the guy who once sat next to you on a bus, and you'd probably see a fuller version of your life than you even did while living it.

Author: Lynsay Sands,  A Quick Bite
Quote: Birthdays could be such a bummer when you were older than the country you lived in.

Author: Roman Payne
Quote: In life, more than in anything else, it isn’t easy to end up alive.

Author: Anthony Robbins
Quote: People are not lazy, they simply have impotent goals..that is..goals that do not inspire them.

Author: Omar Khayyám
Quote: It’s too bad if a heart lacks fire,and is deprived of the light of a heart ablaze.The day on which you arewithout passionate loveis the most wasted day of your life.

Author: Virginia Woolf,  Mrs. Dalloway
Quote: Life stand still here.

Author: Elie Wiesel
Quote: Friendship marks a life even more deeply than love. Love risks degenerating into obsession, friendship is never anything but sharing.

Author: Rabindranath Tagore
Quote: The highest education is that which does not merely give us information but makes our life in harmony with all existence.

Author: David Levithan,  Marly's Ghost
Quote: Life goes on. Get over it. You're still young. It'll get better. Blah, Blah, Blah

Author: Jeannette Walls,  The Glass Castle
Quote: Sometimes you need a little crisis to get your adrenaline flowing and help you realize your potential.

Author: Sue Monk Kidd,  Traveling With Pomegranates: A Mother-Daughter Story
Quote: It shocks me how I wish for...what is lost and cannot come back.

Author: Windhy Puspitadewi
Quote: Kalau ada kupu-kupu yang terperangkap di sarang laba-laba, orang cenderung akan menolong kupu-kupu itu walaupun mungkin si laba-laba belum makan selama berhari-hari..Tapi gimana kalau yang terperangkap adalah ulat yang belum jadi kupu-kupu? Orang tetap nolong nggak? Padahal, keduanya sama. Di dunia ini, memang harus cantik supaya ditolong.

Author: Chuck Palahniuk,  Lullaby
Quote: Anymore, no one's mind is their own.

Author: Matsuo Bashō
Quote: This autumn-why am I growing old?bird disappearing among clouds.

Author: Robert Brault
Quote: Having perfected our disguise, we spend our lives searching for someone we don’t fool.

Author: هاني نقشبندي
Quote: الحياة انتظار دائم لشيء جميل .

Author: Emily Giffin,  Something Borrowed
Quote: Life's not black-and-white. Sometimes the ends justifies the means.

Author: Crystal Woods,  Write like no one is reading
Quote: I know I'm not going to be in your head all the time. But once you know me, I'll be forever in your heart.

Author: Bill Watterson
Quote: HOBBES:Virtue needs some cheaper thrills.

Author: Elbert Hubbard
Quote: True life lies in laughter, love and work.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: She moves through my memory the way the gentle river waves turn the setting sun's rays into a nostalgic light show.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: In my memory her love shimmers, glimmers, and glitters the way light on black water reflects like diamonds, the treasure that was us.

Author: Gary L. Francione
Quote: We do not need to eat animals, wear animals, or use animals for entertainment purposes, and our only defense of these uses is our pleasure, amusement, and convenience.

Author: Gautama Buddha
Quote: To become vegetarian is to step into the stream which leads to nirvana.

Author: Leon Trotsky,  Diary in Exile, 1935
Quote: Life is not an easy matter…. You cannot live through it without falling into frustration and cynicism unless you have before you a great idea which raises you above personal misery, above weakness, above all kinds of perfidy and baseness.

Author: Jocelyn Soriano,  Mend My Broken Heart
Quote: It is our wounds that create in us a desire to reach for miracles. The fulfillment of such miracles depends on whether we let our wounds pull us down or lift us up towards our dreams.

Author: Rainer Maria Rilke
Quote: She who reconciles the ill-matched threadsOf her life, and weaves them gratefullyInto a single cloth – It’s she who drives the loudmouths from the hallAnd clears it for a different celebration.

Author: Emily Giffin,  Something Borrowed
Quote: His words are like the sound of a needle dragging across a record. A sinking, sickening feeling washes over me. This is why you should never, ever get your hopes up. This is why you should see the glass as half empty. So, when the whole things spills, you aren't as devastated.

Author: Kahlil Gibran
Quote: In one drop of water are found all the secrets of all the oceans; in one aspect of You are found all the aspects of existence.

Author: Brian Tracy
Quote: The way you give your name to others is a measure of how much you like and respect yourself.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: 77 degrees in the fall feels cold, and 77 degrees in the spring feels hot. That’s why I’m selling year-round-nudity for half-price.

Author: Michel Houellebecq,  Platform
Quote: Anything can happen in life, especially nothing.

Author: Steve Jobs
Quote: I have a great respect for incremental improvement, and I've done that sort of thing in my life, but I've always been attracted to the more revolutionary changes. I don't know why. Because they're harder. They're much more stressful emotionally. And you usually go through a period where everybody tells you that you've completely failed.

Author: Jim Butcher,  Proven Guilty
Quote: Life can be confusing. Good God, and how. Sometimes it seems like the older I get, the more confused I become. That seems ass-backwards. I thought I was supposed to be getting wiser. Instead, I just keep getting hit over the head with my relative insignificance in the greater scheme of the universe. Confusing, life. But it beats the hell out of the alternative.

Author: Elizabeth Zimmermann
Quote: Properly practiced, knitting soothes the troubled spirit, and it doesn't hurt the untroubled spirit either.

Author: Louise Candlish,  Before We Say Goodbye
Quote: Thinking there is something better out there in the world, something worth more than you already have- of all my mistakes,that was my biggest.

Author: Muhammad Ali Jinnah
Quote: You will have to make up for the smallness of your size by your courage and selfless devotion to duty, for it is not life that matters, but the courage, fortitude and determination you bring to it.

Author: Viktor E. Frankl,  The Doctor and the Soul
Quote: We cannot, after all, judge a biography by its length, by the number of pages in it; we must judge by the richness of the contents...Sometimes the 'unfinisheds' are among the most beautiful symphonies.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Love is 60% water, because a human being, the essence of love, is 60% water. But that’s the other 40% made up of? Easy—mint green tea and honey.

Author: Elizabeth Gilbert,  Eat, Pray, Love
Quote: Parla come magni,' It means, 'Speak the way you eat,' or in my personal translation: 'Say it like you eat it.' It's a reminder - when you're making a big deal out of explaining something, when you're searching for the right words - to keep your language as simple and direct as Roman rood. Don't make a big production out of it. Just lay it on the table.

Author: Cecelia Ahern,  The Book of Tomorrow
Quote: Yesterday was a closed book, tomorrow, however, was another story.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: I wish I could travel west nonstop chasing sunsets. And as the time zones move backwards, I could live forever if I just kept moving.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  liQUID PROse QUOtes
Quote: There are only four times a year I love you: summer, fall, winter, and spring. I'll love you until the sun stops shining, until the clouds dissipate, when Mount Everest no longer has snow, and the flowers stop blooming.-Jarod Kintz and Karen Quan

Author: Katie Kacvinsky,  Awaken
Quote: Life should be a risk. It's more than a straight line that you can see clearly from one point to the other. It dips and curves and you never know what's around the bend sometimes until you get there. That scares a lot of people. But that's the beauty of it.

Author: Jack Kerouac
Quote: Be in love with your life, every detail of it.

Author: Jasmine Warga,  My Heart and Other Black Holes
Quote: I wonder if that's how darkness wins, by convincing us to trap it inside ourselves, instead of emptying it out.I don't want it to win.

Author: مصطفى محمود,  في الحب والحياة
Quote: الدوافع هي الترجمة الحرفية لكلمة روح..عندك دوافع معناها عندك روح ..معناها عندك أمل ..طموح ..حب .شغف ..شهية ..رغبة كل وسائل السعادة

Author: Oscar Wilde,  The Picture of Dorian Gray
Quote: We can have in life but one great experience at best, and the secret of life is to reproduce that experience as often as possible.

Author: Mary Oliver,  Dream Work
Quote: I wanted the past to go away, I wanted to leave it, like another country; I wanted my life to close, and open like a hinge, like a wing, like the part of the song where it falls down over the rocks: an explosion, a discovery; I wanted to hurry into the work of my life; I wanted to know,whoever I was, I wasalive for a little while.

Author: Jonathan Larson,  Rent
Quote: Forget regret, or life is yours to miss. No other path, no other way, no day but today.

Author: Samantha Young,  On Dublin Street
Quote: Sure it could get rough sometimes, but life wasn't a Hollywood movie. Shit happened. You fought, you screamed, and somehow you worked like hell to get out the other side still intact.

Author: Paulo Coelho,  Eleven Minutes
Quote: But if I don’t think about love, I will be nothing.

Author: Haruki Murakami,  Kafka on the Shore
Quote: People soon get tired of things that aren't boring, but not of what is boring.

Author: Kevin Brockmeier,  The View from the Seventh Layer
Quote: ...When you die, the energy that kept you alive filters into the people you loved. Did you know that? It's like a fire you've tended all your life, and the sparks are all scattered into the wind.... That's why we survive as long as we do, because the people who loved us keep us going.

Author: Gautama Buddha
Quote: What is evil? Killing is evil, lying is evil, slandering is evil, abuse is evil, gossip is evil, envy is evil, hatred is evil, to cling to false doctrine is evil; all these things are evil. And what is the root of evil? Desire is the root of evil, illusion is the root of evil.

Author: John Irving,  A Prayer for Owen Meany
Quote: It is your responsibility to find fault with me, it is mine to hear you out. But don't expect me to change.

Author: Tim Burton,  The Melancholy Death of Oyster Boy and Other Stories
Quote: My name is Jimmy,but my friends just call methe hideous penguin boy.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: A chance meeting in a Kansas City coffee shop may take me months of planning and twice a day visits for over a year. But I already have my stunned, surprised, and shocked speech rehearsed for the moment I act like I had no idea she would be there.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: Once your mindset changes, everything on the outside will change along with it.

Author: Paulo Coelho,  Like the Flowing River
Quote: It is part of the human nature always to judge others very severely and,when the wind turns against us,always to find an excuse for our own misdeeds,or to blame someone else for our mistakes.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: Life is a train of moods like a string of beads; and as we pass through them they prove to be many colored lenses, which paint the world their own hue, and each shows us only what lies in its own focus.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: The memory of her love shimmers the way white light ripples gently on the midnight river, and I am currently thirsting to swim in the current that will flow downstream into her wading and waiting arms.

Author: Germaine Greer
Quote: You're only young once, but you can be immature forever

Author: Kristin Cast,  Hunted
Quote: Life isn't a book. There's no guarantee of a happy ending.

Author: Chuck Palahniuk
Quote: The best way to waste your life, is by taking notes. The easiest way to avoid living is to just watch. Look for the details. Report. Don't participate.

Author: Jimmy Buffett
Quote: It takes no more time to see the good side of life than to see the bad.

Author: Suzanne Collins,  Mockingjay
Quote: Slowly, with many lost days, I come back to life.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: I’ve never been in a yesterday quite like today. Seems like the perfect time to be in love.

Author: Irvin D. Yalom,  When Nietzsche Wept
Quote: The spirit of a man is constructed out of his choices.

Author: Karl Lagerfeld
Quote: I am a fashion person, and fashion is not only about clothes -- it's about all kinds of change

Author: Muhammad Ali
Quote: I hated every minute of training, but I said, 'Don't quit. Suffer now and live the rest of your life as a champion.'

Author: Rene Descartes
Quote: If you would be a real seeker after truth, it is necessary that at least once in your life you doubt, as far as possible, all things.

Author: Kurt Vonnegut,  Breakfast of Champions
Quote: People took such awful chances with chemicals and their bodies because they wanted the quality of their lives to improve. They lived in ugly places where there were only ugly things to do. They didn't own doodley-squat, so they couldn't improve their surroundings. so they did their best to make their insides beautiful instead.

Author: Khushwant Singh,  Train to Pakistan
Quote: Not forever does the bulbul singIn balmy shades of bowers,Not forever lasts the springNor ever blossom the flowers.Not forever reigneth joy,Sets the sun on days of bliss,Friendships not forever last,They know not life, who know not this.

Author: Jodi Picoult,  Handle with Care
Quote: What looks like garbage from one angle might be art from another. Maybe it did take a crisis to get to know yourself; maybe you needed to get whacked hard by life before you understood what you wanted out of it.

Author: Seneca,  Natural Questions
Quote: Timendi causa est nescire - Ignorance is the cause of fear.

Author: Shannon L. Alder
Quote: Life always begins with one step outside of your comfort zone.

Author: J.R.R. Tolkien,  The Return of the King
Quote: End? No, the journey doesn't end here. Death is just another path. One that we all must take.

Author: Carson McCullers,  The Heart is a Lonely Hunter
Quote: In his face there came to be a brooding peace that is seen most often in the faces of the very sorrowful or the very wise. But still he wandered through the streets of the town, always silent and alone.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: Happiness is a state of mind, a choice, a way of living; it is not something to be achieved, it is something to be experienced.

Author: Arthur Schopenhauer
Quote: We can regard our life as a uselessly disturbing episode in the blissful repose of nothingness.

Author: E.M. Forster
Quote: The main facts in human life are five: birth, food, sleep, love and death.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: How would your life be different if…You didn’t allow yourself to be defined by your past? Let today be the day…You stop letting your history interfere with your destiny and awaken to the opportunity to release your greatest self.

Author: Harper Lee,  To Kill a Mockingbird
Quote: Atticus had said it was the polite thing to talk to people about what they were interested in, not about what you were interested in.

Author: John Lennon
Quote: There are only a few notes. Just variations on a theme.

Author: Leonardo da Vinci
Quote: Our life is made by the death of others.

Author: Wm. Paul Young,  The Shack
Quote: Grace doesn't depend on suffering to exist, but where there is suffering you will find grace in many facets and colors.

Author: Oscar Wilde,  The Picture of Dorian Gray
Quote: I never approve, or disapprove, of anything now. It is an absurd attitude to take towards life.

Author: Chaim Potok,  My Name Is Asher Lev
Quote: Something that is yours forever is never precious

Author: John Newton
Quote: I am still in the land of the dying; I shall be in the land of the living soon. (his last words)

Author: Leo Buscaglia
Quote: You are the only you ... You are the best you. You will always be the second best anyone else.

Author: Viktor E. Frankl
Quote: Challenging the meaning of life is the truest expression of the state of being human.

Author: Evanescence
Quote: Don't be afraid of the shadows, that only means there's a light nearby.

Author: Vicktor Alexander
Quote: Inside of all of us there is the need and the desire to be heard, to have our innermost thoughts, feelings and desires expressed for others to hear, to see and to understand. We all want to matter to someone, to leave a mark. Writers just take those thoughts, feelings and desires and express them in such a way that the reader not only reads them but feels them as well.

Author: Gregory David Roberts,  Shantaram
Quote: Sometimes we love with nothing more than hope. Sometimes we cry with everything except tears. In the end that’s all there is: love and its duty, sorrow and its truth. In the end that’s all we have - to hold on tight until the dawn

Author: Rachel Vincent,  Stray
Quote: When mice run, cats give chase.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Once a Ponce a time she made me feel like a conquistador. Now her memory is just a breeze seen in swaying Spanish moss.

Author: Joseph Conrad
Quote: Few men realize that their life, the very essence of their character, their capabilities and their audacities, are only the expression of their belief in the safety of their surroundings.

Author: ليلى الجهني,  40 في معنى أن أكبر
Quote: الله عادل، لكن الحياة غير عادلة. الحياة ليست مكانًا للعدل، بل لاختبار حسّنا تجاهه

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: The sun rose and tinted the sky rose, that floral red teeming with romance, and it filtered in thoughts of the love I used to have for her.

Author: Nicholas Sparks,  The Notebook
Quote: I suppose [my life] has most resembled a blue chip stock: fairly stable, more ups than downs, and gradually trending upward over time. A good buy, a lucky buy, and I've learned that not everyone can say that about his life.

Author: Brian Tracy
Quote: Imagine no limitations; decide what's right and desirable before you decide what's possible.

Author: Paulo Coelho,  Brida
Quote: The night is just a part of the day

Author: Laurell K. Hamilton,  Narcissus in Chains
Quote: The heart wants what it wants, Dolp. You don't plan on making your life complicated, it just happens,and you don"t do it on purpose, and you don't do it to hurt people who love you. It just turns out that way sometimes.

Author: Robert Holden
Quote: If you think something is missing in your life, it is probably YOU...

Author: Thomas Aquinas
Quote: The soul is like an uninhabited worldthat comes to life only whenGod lays His headagainst us.

Author: Avi,  The True Confessions of Charlotte Doyle
Quote: A sailor chooses the wind that takes the ship from a safe port. Ah, yes, but once you're abroad, as you have seen, winds have a mind of their own. Be careful, Charlotte, careful of the wind you choose.

Author: Stephen King
Quote: You are the grim, goal-oriented ones who will not believe that the joy is in the journey rather than the destination no matter how many times it has been proven to you.

Author: Alice Sebold,  The Lovely Bones
Quote: Life is a perpetual yesterday for us.

Author: Deepak Chopra
Quote: Non-judgment quiets the internal dialogue, and this opens once again the doorway to creativity.

Author: Jaachynma N.E. Agu,  The Prince and the Pauper
Quote: Don't set your goals by what other people deem important.

Author: Margaret Peterson Haddix,  Among the Hidden
Quote: I want to Live! Not Die, Not Hide, LIVE!

Author: Mark Twain
Quote: What a wee little part of a person's life are his acts and his words! His real life is led in his head, and is known to none but himself.

Author: Brian Tracy
Quote: Excellence/Perfection is not a destination; it is a continuous journey that never ends.

Author: Karen Thompson Walker,  The Age of Miracles
Quote: The only thing you have to do in this life is die,"said Mrs. Pinsky..."everything else is a choice.

Author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón,  The Angel's Game
Quote: We all give up great expectations along the way.

Author: Bauvard,  I Had a Dream About You
Quote: I had a dream about you. I was sitting on your couch, relating my succession of ideas on subconscious influence. I asked you what they meant, and you told me that free associations were a bad way to advance my political career.

Author: Douglas Coupland,  All Families are Psychotic
Quote: She thought about her life and how lost she’d felt for most of it. She thought about the way that all truths she’d been taught to consider valuable invariably conflicted with the world as it was actually lived. How could a person be so utterly lost, yet remain living?

Author: Sarah Dessen
Quote: Because you have to just go with the flow. Your life is not your own, with people coming in and out all the time. You get mellow because you have to.

Author: Michael Summers,  I Had a Dream About You
Quote: I had a dream about you last night. I could fly. I was going to use this power to impress you, but you were too heavy to carry, so I won you over with my personality instead

Author: Reba McEntire
Quote: Living might mean taking chances, but they're worth taking. Loving might be a mistake. but its worth making

Author: Winston S. Churchill
Quote: This is not the end, this is not even the beginning of the end, this is just perhaps the end of the beginning.

Author: Sophie Kinsella,  The Undomestic Goddess
Quote: A mistake isn’t a mistake unless it can’t be put right.

Author: Stephen King,  Duma Key
Quote: We fool ourselves so much we could do it for a living.

Author: Anne Lamott,  Bird by Bird: Some Instructions on Writing and Life
Quote: We all know we're going to die; what's important is the kind of men and women we are in the face of this.

Author: Woody Allen
Quote: All people know the same truth. Our lives consist of how we choose to distort it.

Author: Nicola Yoon,  Everything, Everything
Quote: Life is a gift. Don't forget to live it.

Author: Pablo
Quote: No matter how many people believe or don’t believe in you, you must bethe ultimate believer in yourself!

Author: Robin S. Sharma,  The Monk Who Sold His Ferrari: A Fable About Fulfilling Your Dreams & Reaching Your Destiny
Quote: Push yourself to do more and to experience more. Harness your energy to start expanding your dreams. Yes, expand your dreams. Don't accept a life of mediocrity when you hold such infinite potential within the fortress of your mind. Dare to tap into your greatness.

Author: Bob Ong
Quote: Nalaman kong habang lumalaki ka, maraming beses kang madadapa. Bumangon ka man ulit o hindi, magpapatuloy ang buhay, iikot ang mundo, at mauubos ang oras.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: I want to love you down. I want to love you deep. I want to love you up. And I want to love you width all my heart. Now that is #4DFeeling.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: The pink sunset reminds me of her, and the calm water matches the calm that images of her bring to my heart.

Author: Madonna
Quote: I am my own experiment. I am my own work of art.

Author: Hannah Harrington,  Saving June
Quote: Some people think that a place can save them... Like if they could just be somewhere else, their lives would be totally different. They could finally be the people they always wanted to be. But to me, a place is just a place. If you really want things to change, you can make them change no matter where you are.

Author: Cynthia Hand,  Unearthly
Quote: The backcountry signs say stuff like BEYOND THIS POINT IS A HIGH RISK AREA, WHICH HAS MANY HAZARDS INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, AVALANCHES, CLIFFS, AND HIDDEN OBSTACLES, YOU MAY BE RESPONSIBLE FOR THE COST OF YOUR RESCUE and I think, um, no thanks. I choose life.

Author: Deepak Chopra
Quote: Each of us is a unique strand in the intricate web of life and here to make a contribution.

Author: Miguel de Unamuno
Quote: Life is doubt,And faith without doubt is nothing but death.

Author: Douglas Adams,  The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy Omnibus
Quote: He stood up straight and looked the world squarely in the fields and hills. To add weight to his words he stuck the rabbit bone in his hair. He spread his arm out wide. "I will go mad!"he annouced.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  Write like no one is reading 3
Quote: I cry, but not for myself. There’s too much sadness in this world to waste a moment with self-pity, when making others smile will also make me smile.

Author: Rosie Thomas
Quote: Things don't matter, people do

Author: Dione Lucas
Quote: The preparation of good food is merely another expression of art, one of the joys of civilized living…

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Flowers are aromatic and romantic, and they grow exactly the way love does—with plenty of light, and watered with affection.

Author: Brian Tracy
Quote: The more you seek security, the less of it you have. But the more you seek opportunity, the more likely it is that you will achieve the security that you desire.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Clutching to your fading youth is like trying to hang on to a handful of smoke. Just breathe deeply and you’ll be OK.

Author: Jim Butcher,  Death Masks
Quote: I'm dealing with a lot of scary things. I think you have to react to them. And you either laugh at them or you go insane.

Author: Mary E. Pearson,  The Adoration of Jenna Fox
Quote: Pieces. A bit for someone here. A bit there. And sometimes they don't add up to anything whole. But you are so busy dancing. Delivering. You don't have time to notice. Or are afraid to notice. And then one day you have to look. And it's true. All of your pieces fill up other people's holes. But they don't fill your own.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: I am never alone wherever I am. The air itself supplies me with a century of love. When I breathe in, I am breathing in the laughter, tears, victories, passions, thoughts, memories, existence, joys, moments, and the hues of the sunlight on many tones of skin; I am breathing in the same air that was exhaled by many before me. The air that bore them life. And so how can I ever say that I am alone?

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: My love has a flow like a flower, so it’s best if you water it with the fragrance of romance, which has the aroma of loyalty.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: The only problem with dreaming is it's a solo activity. Imagine how glorious life would be if we could share dreams and create in unison.

Author: Stephen Jay Gould,  The Flamingo's Smile: Reflections in Natural History
Quote: We have become, by the power of a glorious evolutionary accident called intelligence, the stewards of life's continuity on earth. We did not ask for this role, but we cannot abjure it. We may not be suited to it, but here we are.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: The heart pumps blood, a fluid, but it also pulses love, which is as liquid as a wave, and everyone wants a refill. My goal is to be a server.

Author: Lang Leav
Quote: Letting him goThere is a particular kind of suffering to be experienced when you love something greater than yourself. A tender sacrifice. Like the pained silence felt in the lost song of a mermaid; or the bent and broken feet of a dancing ballerina. It is in every considered step I am taking in the opposite direction of you.

Author: Joseph Campbell
Quote: A hero is someone who has given his or her life to something bigger than oneself.

Author: Tony Robbins
Quote: One reason so few of us achieve what we truly want is that we never direct our focus; we never concentrate our power. Most people dabble their way through life, never deciding to master anything in particular.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  Write like no one is reading 3
Quote: People won't buy study guides for a dollar, but they will pay 100 dollars for test answers. A ‪#startup‬‬‬‬ should keep this mentality in mind.

Author: أحمد العسيلي,  كتاب مالوش اسم
Quote: جميلة الحياة بانها ما بتفضلش أبدا على حالها, جميلة بتغير الفصول والطلوع والنزول, جميلة الحياة بتغيرها. جميلة بكل ما فيها من حيرة وتساؤل و فضول, جميلة الحياة بالذكريات و بكل ما فيها من جنون.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: A writer used to live life like Julius Seizure: I came, I saw, I queried. Now you can take control of your consciousness and self-publish.

Author: Morgan Matson,  Since You've Been Gone
Quote: In a well-ordered universe...

Author: Tess Gerritsen,  The Sinner
Quote: The dead do not hurt you; only the living do.

Author: John Green,  Paper Towns
Quote: I always felt like you had to be important to have enemies.

Author: Kristin Cashore,  Fire
Quote: If her enemies were Brigan's friends and her friends were Brigan's enemies, then the two of them could walk through the world arm in arm and never be hit by arrows again.

Author: Philip Pullman,  Clockwork
Quote: You don't win races by wishing, you win them by running faster than everyone else does.

Author: Jeff Foxworthy
Quote: The problem with the designated driver program, it's not a desirable job, but if you ever get sucked into doing it, have fun with it. At the end of the night, drop them off at the wrong house.

Author: Stefan Zweig,  The World of Yesterday
Quote: Only the person who has experienced light and darkness, war and peace, rise and fall, only that person has truly experienced life.

Author: Kazuya Minekura,  Stigma
Quote: My heart hurts that means I’m alive.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  Write like no one is reading 3
Quote: I thirst for love like a camel thirsts for water. I’m going through a desert right now, but I’m searching for the oasis of my life.

Author: Lisi Harrison
Quote: Truth is beauty

Author: Brenda Ueland
Quote: I learned...that inspiration does not come like a bolt, nor is it kinetic, energetic striving, but it comes into us slowly and quietly and all the time, though we must regularly and every day give it a little chance to start flowing, prime it with a little solitude and idleness.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book Has No Title
Quote: There’s truth in only having a bicycle seat. I used to skip class and just hold it out in the hallway. When teachers would ask me what I was doing, I’d hold it up and say, “Sorry I’m late.

Author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
Quote: Ah, Nothing is too late, till the tired heart shall cease to palpitate.

Author: Virginia Woolf,  Orlando
Quote: By the truth we are undone. Life is a dream. 'Tis the waking that kills us. He who robs us of our dreams robs us of our life.

Author: Darynda Jones,  Third Grave Dead Ahead
Quote: After a long, labored sigh, I said, “She was really happy when I got there. I’m pretty sure she was suicidal when I left.”“You do have that effect on people.

Author: Eminem
Quote: I need drama in my life to keep making music.

Author: Marcus Aurelius,  Meditations
Quote: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts: therefore, guard accordingly, and take care that you entertain no notions unsuitable to virtue and reasonable nature.

Author: Stephen Colbert,  I Am America
Quote: Clearly, America has no shortage of metaphorical opportunities for the poor.

Author: Isaac Bashevis Singer
Quote: Kindness, I’ve discovered, is everything in life.

Author: Garth Stein,  The Art of Racing in the Rain
Quote: Such a simple concept, yet so true: that which we manifest is before us; we are the creators of our own destiny. Be it through intention or ignorance, our successes and our failures have been brought on by none other than ourselves.

Author: Nikki Sixx,  This Is Gonna Hurt: Music, Photography, And Life Through The Distorted Lens Of Nikki Sixx
Quote: Love those who hurt you the most, because they are probably the ones closest to you.They, too, are on a path, and just like you they are learning to walk before they can fly. Imagine of everybody you hurt in life turned their backs on you? You would be playing a hell of a lot of solitaire. Love them no matter what.

Author: Mitch Albom
Quote: Sometimes, kids want you to hurt the way they hurt.

Author: Gayle Forman,  Where She Went
Quote: So, this is how it's become? This is how I've become? A walking contradiction? I'm surrounded by people and feel alone. I claim to crave a bit of normalcy but now that I have some, it's like I don't know what to do with it, I don't know how to be a normal person anymore.

Author: E.L. Konigsburg
Quote: Some days you must learn a great deal. But you should also have days when you allow what is already in you to swell up and touch everything. If you never let that happen, then you just accumulate facts, and they begin to rattle around inside of you.

Author: Mitch Albom,  For One More Day
Quote: I thought about the days i had handed over to a bottle..the nights i can't remember..the mornings i slept thru..all the time spent running from myself.

Author: Mitch Albom,  Have a Little Faith: a True Story
Quote: The story of my recent life.' I like that phrase. It makes more sense than 'the story of my life', because we get so many lives between birth and death. A life to be a child. A life to come of age. A life to wander, to settle, to fall in love, to parent, to test our promise, to realize our mortality- and in some lucky cases, to do something after that realization.

Author: Elif Shafak
Quote: Whatever happens in your life, no matter how troubling things might seem, do not enter the neighbourhood of despair.Even when all doors remain closed, God wil open up a new path only for you. Be thankful! It is easy to be thankful when all is well. A Sufi is thankful not only for what he has been given but also for all that has been denied.

Author: Portia de Rossi
Quote: Life can take so many twists and turns. You can’t ever count yourself out. Even if you’re really afraid at some point, you can’t think that there’s no room for you to grow and do something good with your life.

Author: Sylvia Plath,  The Bell Jar
Quote: I saw the years of my life spaced along a road in the form of telephone poles threaded together by wires. I counted one, two, three... nineteen telephone poles, and then the wires dangled into space, and try as I would, I couldn't see a single pole beyond the nineteenth.

Author: Nick Hornby,  High Fidelity
Quote: my friends don't seem to be friends at all but people whose phone numbers I haven't lost.

Author: Walter Bagehot
Quote: Life is a compromise of what your ego wants to do, what experience tells you to do, and what your nerves let you do.

Author: Anthony Robbins
Quote: It is in your moments of decision that your destiny is shaped.

Author: Graham Greene
Quote: Despair is the price one pays for setting oneself an impossible aim. It is, one is told, the unforgivable sin, but it is a sin the corrupt or evil man never practices. He always has hope. He never reaches the freezing-point of knowing absolute failure. Only the man of goodwill carries always in his heart this capacity for damnation.

Author: Tom Stoppard,  Rock 'n' Roll
Quote: I am not my body. My body is nothing without me.

Author: Al Franken
Quote: Mistakes are a part of being human. Appreciate your mistakes for what they are: precious life lessons that can only be learned the hard way. Unless it's a fatal mistake, which, at least, others can learn from.

Author: Margaret Atwood,  The Tent
Quote: Time folds you in its arms and gives you one last kiss, and then it flattens you out and folds you up and tucks you away until it's time for you to become someone else's past time, and then time folds again.

Author: Erin Morgenstern,  The Night Circus
Quote: You will be fine,' the fortune teller says. 'There may be decisions to make and surprises in store. Life takes us to unexpected places sometimes. The future is never set in stone, remember that.

Author: Carrie Fisher
Quote: I don’t want life to imitate art. I want life to BE art.

Author: Suzanne Collins,  Mockingjay
Quote: Knowing it and seeing it are two different things.

Author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy
Quote: I will never deny that life isn't fair. It seems as though when a woman leaves a man she is strong and independent, but when a man leaves a woman he is a pig and a jerk.

Author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Sr.
Quote: Insanity is often the logic of an accurate mind overtasked. Good mental machinery ought to break its own wheels and levers, if anything is thrust among them suddenly which tends to stop them or reverse their motion. A weak mind does not accumulate force enough to hurt itself; stupidity often saves a man from going mad.

Author: Whoopi Goldberg
Quote: Art and life are subjective. Not everybody's gonna dig what I dig, but I reserve the right to dig it.

Author: John Green,  Looking for Alaska
Quote: I must talk, and you must listen, for we are engaged here in the most important pursuit in history: the search for meaning. What is the nature of being a person? What is the best way to go about being a person? How did we come to be, and what will become of us when we are no longer? In short: What are the rules of this game, and how might we best play it?

Author: Mitsugi Saotome
Quote: If you were all alone in the universe with no one to talk to, no one with which to share the beauty of the stars, to laugh with, to touch, what would be your purpose in life? It is other life; it is love, which gives your life meaning. This is harmony. We must discover the joy of each other, the joy of challenge, the joy of growth.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: The heart sees what the eyes do not, and the heart hears what the ears cannot. Sight and sound are vibrations, and so is love.

Author: Kelly Cutrone,  If You Have to Cry, Go Outside: And Other Things Your Mother Never Told You
Quote: When you're the most happening person at the party, it's time to leave

Author: Jonathan Anthony Burkett,  Friends 2 Lovers: The Unthinkable
Quote: It's better to have a few faithful friends than numerous shallow friendships.

Author: Jhumpa Lahiri,  The Namesake
Quote: Pack a pillow and blanket and see as much of the world as you can.You will not regret it.

Author: Steve Jobs
Quote: Remembering that you are going to die is the best way I know to avoid the trap of thinking you have something to lose.

Author: Madeleine L'Engle
Quote: I do not think that I will ever reach a stage when I will say, "This is what I believe. Finished."What I believe is alive ... and open to growth

Author: Aaron Sorkin
Quote: Toby Zeigler: There's literally no one in the world I don't hate right now.

Author: Bob Dylan
Quote: I failed to communicate, that's why I chose to leave

Author: Brian Tracy
Quote: Every minute you spend in planning saves 10 minutes in execution; this gives you a 1,000 percent Return on Energy!

Author: Ernestine Gilbreth Carey,  Belles on Their Toes
Quote: In a person's lifetime there may be not more than half a dozen occasions that he can look back to in the certain knowledge that right then, at that moment, there was room for nothing but happiness in his heart.

Author: Susane Colasanti,  Waiting for You
Quote: The rain fluctuates between drizzle and torrential. It messes with your mind. It makes you think things will always be like this, never getting better, always letting you down right when you though the worst was over.

Author: Amy Sedaris,  I Like You: Hospitality Under the Influence
Quote: My mother always said 'Don't bother other people.' I think that's good advice.

Author: W. C. Fields
Quote: When we have lost everything, including hope, life becomes a disgrace, and death a duty.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: I find Bukowski to be so edgy, gritty, and daring that he oozes romance, and if couples read him in bed they would appreciate what they have.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: A #startup is as fragile as a flower, and it needs a garden and a gardener to help it grow. Those gardens are called Business Incubators.

Author: Joan F. Marques
Quote: When it rains it pours. Maybe the art of life is to convert tough times to great experiences: we can choose to hate the rain or dance in it.

Author: Truman Capote,  Summer Crossing
Quote: Most of life is so dull it is not worth discussing, and it is dull at all ages. When we change our brand of cigarette, move to a new neighborhood, subscribe to a different newspaper, fall in and out of love, we are protesting in ways both frivolous and deep against the not to be diluted dullness of day-to-day living.

Author: Charles M. Schulz,  The Complete Peanuts, Vol. 5: 1959-1960
Quote: Sometimes I feel that life has passed me by... Do you ever feel that way, Charlie Brown?""I feel that it has knocked me down and walked all over me!

Author: Megan McCafferty,  Second Helpings
Quote: You gotta take chances in this life or you're alreadydead.

Author: Toba Beta,  Master of Stupidity
Quote: If you say that you never lie in life,you honestly insult my intelligence.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: I am so grateful for my troubles. As I reflect back on my life, I have come to realize that my greatest triumphs have been born of my greatest troubles.

Author: Ernest Hemingway,  The Sun Also Rises
Quote: Nobody ever lives their life all the way up except bullfighters.

Author: Mary Daly
Quote: The word ‘sin’ is derived from the Indo-European root ‘es-,’ meaning ‘to be.’ When I discovered this etymology, I intuitively understood that for a [person] trapped in patriarchy, which is the religion of the entire planet, ‘to be’ in the fullest sense is ‘to sin'.

Author: Elizabeth Taylor
Quote: I feel very adventurous. There are so many doors to be opened, and I'm not afraid to look behind them.

Author: Hlovate,  Contengan Jalanan
Quote: Hidup hanya ada erti pada yang bahagia.

Author: Nick Hornby,  A Long Way Down
Quote: When your sad--like really sad--you only want to be with other people who are sad.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: I curse in cursive. It's hard to read and harder take. But if you take it black, like coffee, then at least it may wake you up to the realities of life.

Author: Patrick Ness,  The Ask and the Answer
Quote: So we forgive each other?"The crooked smile climbs up one more time. "Again?"And I look right into his eyes, right into him as far as I can see, because I want him to hear me, I want him to hear me with everything I mean and feel and say."Always,"I say to him. "Every time.

Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry,  The Little Prince
Quote: You will have five hundred million little bells, and I shall have five hundred million springs of fresh water...

Author: Tori Amos
Quote: I know I'm an acquired taste - I'm anchovies. And not everybody wants those hairy little things.

Author: Shannon Delany,  13 to Life
Quote: You know, considering your IQ, you're really socially retarded sometimes.

Author: E.M. Forster,  A Room with a View
Quote: Life' wrote a friend of mine, 'is a public performance on the violin, in which you must learn the instrument as you go along.

Author: Philip Pullman,  The Golden Compass
Quote: That’s the duty of the old, to be anxious on behalf of the young. And the duty of the young is to scorn the anxiety of the old.

Author: Sarah Dessen,  This Lullaby
Quote: My mother was strong, in all the ways I was weak. She fell, she hurt, she felt. She lived. And for all the tumble of her experiences, she still had hope. Maybe this next time would do the trick. Or maybe not. But unless you stepped into the game, you will never know.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: The heart is man’s treasure, and that’s why it’s locked in a cage of ribs with only one key. The key isn’t metal or material—it’s the feeling of love.

Author: Hayao Miyazaki
Quote: Personally I am very pessimistic. But when, for instance, one of my staff has a baby you can't help but bless them for a good future. Because I can't tell that child, 'Oh, you shouldn't have come into this life.' And yet I know the world is heading in a bad direction. So with those conflicting thoughts in mind, I think about what kind of films I should be making.

Author: Hermann Hesse,  Siddhartha
Quote: Not in his speech, not in his thoughts, I see his greatness, only in his actions, in his life.

Author: Kurt Vonnegut
Quote: Do you realize that all great literature — "Moby Dick,""Huckleberry Finn,""A Farewell to Arms,""The Scarlet Letter,""The Red Badge of Courage,""The Iliad and The Odyssey,""Crime and Punishment,"the Bible, and "The Charge of the Light Brigade"— are all about what a bummer it is to be a ...human being?

Author: Diana Wynne Jones,  Archer's Goon
Quote: Learn to drive?""Never,"said Quentin. "My mission in life is to be a passenger.

Author: William S. Burroughs,  Letters to Allen Ginsberg, 1953-1957
Quote: Whether you like it or not, you are committed to the human endeavor. I cannot ally myself with such a purely negative goal as avoidance of suffering. Suffering is a chance you take by the fact of being alive.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: The trick to looking ageless is drinking 55 gallons of #FlashBangWowFuzz every 4-6 hours. 24-hour discounts available.

Author: Gerard Way
Quote: Those guys who want to have the Mohawk...which, to me, is the new business casual.

Author: Charles M. Schulz
Quote: Life is like a ten speed bicycle. Most of us have gears we never use.

Author: Madeleine L'Engle
Quote: It takes too much energy to be against something unless it's really important.

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: If you want to be a grocer, or a general, or a politician, or a judge, you will invariably become it; that is your punishment. If you never know what you want to be, if you live what some might call the dynamic life but what I will call the artistic life, if each day you are unsure of who you are and what you know you will never become anything, and that is your reward.

Author: Lauren Oliver,  Delirium
Quote: Most of us won't see one another after graduation, and even if we do it will be different. We'll be different. We'll be adults--cured, tagged and labeled and paired and identified and placed neatly on our life path, perfectly round marbles set to roll down even, well-defined slopes.

Author: Carl Sagan
Quote: We are star stuff harvesting sunlight.

Author: Mary Harris Jones
Quote: Pray for the dead and fight like hell for the living.

Author: Sarah Dessen,  The Moon and More
Quote: The thing is, you can’t always have the best of everything. Because for a life to be real, you need it all: good and bad, beach and concrete, the familiar and the unknown, big talkers and small towns.

Author: Steve Maraboli
Quote: Temptation is the feeling we get when encountered by an opportunity to do what we innately know we shouldn't.

Author: Kahlil Gibran,  Sand and Foam
Quote: Desire is half of life; indifference is half of death.

Author: Alan Moore,  Watchmen
Quote: A live body and a dead body contain the same number of particles. Structurally, there's no discernible difference. Life and death are unquantifiable abstracts. Why should I be concerned?

Author: Stephen Chbosky
Quote: I can see it. This one moment when you know you’re not a sad story. You’re alive. And you stand up and see the lights and the buildings and everything that makes you wonder. And you’re listening to that song in that drive with the people you love most in this world. And in this moment I swear… we are infinite.

Author: Conan O'Brien
Quote: It is our failure to become our perceived ideal that ultimately defines us and makes us unique. It's not easy, but if you accept your misfortune and handle it right your perceived failure can become a catalyst for profound re-invention.

Author: Ally Condie
Quote: And I'll tell her that I don't want my life to be samples and scraps. A taste of everything but a meal of nothing.

Author: Susane Colasanti,  Take Me There
Quote: Because if you take a risk, you just might find what you're looking for.

Author: Gillian Flynn,  Gone Girl
Quote: ...and you drink a little too much and try a little too hard. And you go home to a cold bed and think, 'That was fine'. And your life is a long line of fine.

Author: Roman Payne
Quote: When she was a child, my love carried a road-map in her hand the way other girls carried handkerchiefs. She always knew the way. Her feet were little wings. And her beautiful head was a compass.

Author: Sarah Kay
Quote: Some people read palms to tell your future, but I read hands to tell your past. Each scar makes a story worth telling. Each callused palm, each cracked knuckle is a missed punch or years in a factory.

Author: Marie Lu,  The Rose Society
Quote: The irony of life is that those who wear masks often tell us more truths than those with open faces.

Author: Dave Eggers,  A Heartbreaking Work of Staggering Genius
Quote: If you don't want anyone to know about your existence, you might as well kill yourself. You're taking up space, air.

Author: Stephen King,  Full Dark, No Stars
Quote: Life is fair. We all get the same nine-month shake in the box, and then the dice roll. Some people get a run of sevens. Some people, unfortunately, get snake-eyes. Its just how the world is.

Author: Iain Thomas
Quote: But life isn't something that should be edited. Life shouldn't be cut. The only way you'll ever discover what it truly means to be alive and human is by sharing the full experience of what it means to be human and each blemish and freckle that comes with it.

Author: Cormac McCarthy
Quote: Anything that doesn't take years of your life and drive you to suicide hardly seems worth doing.

Author: Amit Ray
Quote: Do not live in the shadow of the masters for ever. Learn to live in the light of your soul. Life deserves full expression.

Author: Ludwig van Beethoven
Quote: Music is the mediator between the spiritual and the sensual life.

Author: S.L. Jennings,  Fear of Falling
Quote: Life may not be pretty but it's always beautiful. We may only see the ugliness on the surface. The shit that only the world chooses to notice. But, if we dig deep, if we get to the heart of life, where there's no pain or fear, where we can just be who we are and love freely without judgement, it's really beautiful.

Author: Richard Yates,  Revolutionary Road
Quote: You want to play house, you got to have a job. You want to play very nice house, very sweet house, then you got to have a job you don't like. Great. This is the way ninety-eight-point-nine per cent of the people work things out, so believe me, buddy, you've got nothing to apologize for.

Author: Ian McEwan,  Atonement
Quote: He knew these last lines by heart and mouthed them now in the darkness. My reason for life. Not living, but life. That was the touch. And she was his reason for life, and why he must survive.

Author: Dan Brown,  The Da Vinci Code
Quote: Learning the truth has become my life's love.

Author: Mary Hoffman,  City of Flowers
Quote: There are some choices you can only make once. You can't go back to where you made a choice and then take the other one.

Author: Steven Erikson,  Midnight Tides
Quote: Destiny is a lie. Destiny is justification for atrocity. It is the means by which murderers armour themselves against reprimand. It is a word intended to stand in place of ethics, denying all moral context.

Author: Xiaolu Guo
Quote: Its important to be comfortable with uncertainty.

Author: Justina Chen,  North of Beautiful
Quote: Maybe getting around in life was nothing but map-reading. A skill that required practice. A key to unlock where you wanted to go. A legend to show where you were.

Author: Antonio Machado
Quote: Between living and dreaming there is a third thing. Guess it.

Author: Tonya Hurley,  Ghostgirl
Quote: We all like to think the world ends when we do. The truth is our acquaintances, our friends, and our loved ones all live on, and through them, so do we. It's not about what you had, but what you gave. It's not about how you looked, but how you lived. And it's not just about being remembered. It's about giving people a good reason to remember you.

Author: H.P. Lovecraft
Quote: All life is only a set of pictures in the brain, among which there is no difference betwixt those born of real things and those born of inward dreamings, and no cause to value the one above the other.

Author: Charles M. Schulz,  Charles M. Schulz: Conversations
Quote: I don't know the meaning of life. I don't know why we are here. I think life is full of anxieties and fears and tears. It has a lot of grief in it, and it can be very grim. And I do not want to be the one who tries to tell somebody else what life is all about. To me it's a complete mystery.

Author: Bob Dylan
Quote: You better start swimming, or you'll sink like a stone. Because the Time's they are a-changing.

Author: Loretta Girzaitis
Quote: If someone listens, or stretches out a hand, or whispers a kind word of encouragement, or attempts to understand a lonely person, extraordinary things begin to happen.

Author: Ray Bradbury,  The Fog Horn
Quote: That's life for you,"said MacDunn. "Someone always waiting for someone who never comes home. Always someone loving some thing more than that thing loves them. And after a while you want to destroy whatever that thing is, so it can't hurt you no more.

Author: Eckhart Tolle
Quote: What will be left of all the fearing and wanting associated with your problematic life situation that every day takes up most of your attention? A dash, one or two inches long, between the date of birth and date of death on your gravestone.

Author: Eda J. LeShan
Quote: When we cannot bear to be alone, it means we do not properly value the only companion we will have from birth to death - ourselves.

Author: Jodi Picoult,  My Sister's Keeper
Quote: You know how the tightrope guy at the circus wants everyone to believe his act is an art, but deep down you can see that he's really just hoping he makes it all the way across?

Author: Alysha Speer,  Sharden
Quote: Life is hell, at some point we all just have to get used to it.

Author: Cecelia Ahern,  Thanks for the Memories
